headline: Logistics15:00 | Feb 04, 2026IndiGo to suspend Copenhagen operations from Feb 17, trims flights on Delhi-Manchester route
condensed_text:
Logistics15:00 | Feb 04, 2026IndiGo to suspend Copenhagen operations from Feb 17, trims flights on Delhi-Manchester route. PTI
IndiGo on Wednesday announced adjusting its long-haul flight schedule, including suspending services to Copenhagen from February 17, due to external operational constraints. In a statement, the airline said its wide-body operation has faced external operational constraints such as continuously changing airspace constraints due to geopolitical circumstances, congestion at airports both in India and abroad. “These factors significantly increased flight and block times causing strain over the airline’s 787-9 schedule that is operated with six wide-body aircraft,” it said. “This scale adjustment was originally planned to be introduced in the summer schedule 2026; however, it is being executed earlier to ensure reliability to the rest of IndiGo’s long-haul operations,” the statement said.
full_content:
From February 7, the carrier will reduce its Delhi–Manchester services to four times a week from five times per week. On this route, the number of flights will be cut to three times per week from February 19.
PTI
IndiGo on Wednesday announced adjusting its long-haul flight schedule, including suspending services to Copenhagen from February 17, due to external operational constraints.
Besides, the airline will reduce flights on Delhi–London Heathrow and Delhi–Manchester routes.
In a statement, the airline said its wide-body operation has faced external operational constraints such as continuously changing airspace constraints due to geopolitical circumstances, congestion at airports both in India and abroad.
“These factors significantly increased flight and block times causing strain over the airline’s 787-9 schedule that is operated with six wide-body aircraft,” it said.
As part of the network adjustment, the airline will suspend flights to and from Copenhagen (Denmark) from February 17 till further notice.
From February 7, the carrier will reduce its Delhi–Manchester services to four times a week from five times per week. On this route, the number of flights will be cut to three times per week from February 19.
“This scale adjustment was originally planned to be introduced in the summer schedule 2026; however, it is being executed earlier to ensure reliability to the rest of IndiGo’s long-haul operations,” the statement said.
Further, Delhi-London Heathrow services will be cut to four from five per week for the current winter schedule starting from February 9.
IndiGo said the measures are being taken to avoid inconvenience to passengers due to misconnections and cascading delays.
Published on  February 4, 2026

headline: Emami shares surge 9% post Q3 earnings as PAT grows 15% YoY, Rs 6/share dividend announcement
condensed_text: Shares of FMCG company Emami surged 9% on Wednesday to hit the day's high of Rs 528 on the NSE following a 15% jump in its December quarter consolidated net profit at Rs 319 crore compared to Rs 279 crore reported in the year-ago period. The company's bottom line surged 115% on a sequential basis versus Rs 148 crore in Q2FY26, while the topline was up 44% versus Rs 799 crore in the July-September quarter of FY26. The gross margins in Q3 were at 70.6%, improving by 30 bps Live Events The Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortisation (EBIDTA) stood at Rs 384 crore, growing by 13%, while the EBIDTA margins were at 33.4%, expanding by 110 bps. Also read: Bajaj Finserv Q3 Results: Revenue jumps 24% YoY to Rs 39,708 crore, PAT growth flat The profit before tax (PBT) before exceptional items stood at Rs 355 crore, up 18% YoY. Rural demand continued to be resilient, aided by stable agricultural incomes and supportive government initiatives, while urban demand showed gradual improvement, supported by easing inflation and stable employment conditions," the company said in a press statement.
full_content: Shares of FMCG company Emami surged 9% on Wednesday to hit the day's high of Rs 528 on the NSE following a 15% jump in its December quarter consolidated net profit at Rs 319 crore compared to Rs 279 crore reported in the year-ago period. The profit after tax (PAT) is attributable to the equity holders of the parent. The company's revenue from operations stood at Rs 1,152 crore in Q3FY26, up 10% over Rs 1,049 crore posted in the corresponding period of the last financial year. The company also declared a second interim dividend of Rs 6 per equity share for the financial year 2025-26. The company has set the record date on Tuesday, February 10, 2026, and the interim dividend will be paid by March 6, 2026. The company's bottom line surged 115% on a sequential basis versus Rs 148 crore in Q2FY26, while the topline was up 44% versus Rs 799 crore in the July-September quarter of FY26. The company incurred expenses of Rs 768 crore in the quarter under review versus Rs 620 crore in Q2FY26 and Rs 711 crore in Q3FY25. The expenses were incurred under the heads like cost of materials consumed, employee benefits and advertisements & sales promotion, among others. This implies a 24% QoQ and 8% QoQ. The gross margins in Q3 were at 70.6%, improving by 30 bps Live Events The Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortisation (EBIDTA) stood at Rs 384 crore, growing by 13%, while the EBIDTA margins were at 33.4%, expanding by 110 bps. Also read: Bajaj Finserv Q3 Results: Revenue jumps 24% YoY to Rs 39,708 crore, PAT growth flat The profit before tax (PBT) before exceptional items stood at Rs 355 crore, up 18% YoY. "The third quarter marked a period of strong and broad-based performance, aligned with the company’s strategic priorities and expectations. The quarter witnessed a sequential improvement following the GST 2.0-related disruptions that impacted the early part of the period. A favourable winter season supported a stronger offtake across the winter portfolio and health supplements. Rural demand continued to be resilient, aided by stable agricultural incomes and supportive government initiatives, while urban demand showed gradual improvement, supported by easing inflation and stable employment conditions," the company said in a press statement. headline: Century Plyboards Q3 Results: Net profit rises 9%, margin at 12.6%
condensed_text: Century Plyboards Q3 Results: Net profit rises 9%, margin at 12.6%. Shares of Century Plyboards  Ltd. were trading with losses of up to 5% in Wednesday's session on February 4, despite the company reporting a largely strong set of earnings for the December quarter.Century Plyboards reported a 9.4% year-on-year rise in net profit at ₹64 crore for the quarter under review, compared with ₹58.4 crore in the corresponding period last year.Revenue for the quarter grew a healthy 18.4% year-on-year to ₹1,350 crore, as against ₹1,140 crore reported a year ago.Operating performance improved, with EBITDA rising 32% year-on-year to ₹170.5 crore from ₹129.2 crore in the year ago period.This led to an expansion in operating margins, which improved to 12.6% in the December quarter from 11.3% in the same quarter last year.
full_content: Shares of Century Plyboards  Ltd. were trading with losses of up to 5% in Wednesday's session on February 4, despite the company reporting a largely strong set of earnings for the December quarter.Century Plyboards reported a 9.4% year-on-year rise in net profit at ₹64 crore for the quarter under review, compared with ₹58.4 crore in the corresponding period last year.Revenue for the quarter grew a healthy 18.4% year-on-year to ₹1,350 crore, as against ₹1,140 crore reported a year ago.Operating performance improved, with EBITDA rising 32% year-on-year to ₹170.5 crore from ₹129.2 crore in the year ago period.This led to an expansion in operating margins, which improved to 12.6% in the December quarter from 11.3% in the same quarter last year.

headline: AstraZeneca gets CDSCO approval for Durvalumab in gastric cancer treatment
condensed_text: AstraZeneca Pharma India on Wednesday said it has received approval from the national health regulator for Durvalumab in combination with chemotherapy for treatment of gastric or gastroesophageal junction cancer. The Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) has granted approval for Durvalumab in combination with  FLOT chemotherapy (fluorouracil, leucovorin, oxaliplatin and docetaxel) as the first and only perioperative immunotherapy approach for adult patients with resectable gastric or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma. Despite treatment with FLOT, five-year survival remains below 50 per cent, and recurrence rates are high within two years of surgery, underscoring the need for more effective peri-operative options. Backed by the MATTERHORN study, this approval brings immunotherapy earlier in the treatment pathway, significantly improving survival," AstraZeneca Pharma India  Country President and MD Praveen Rao Akkinepally said in a statement. Gastric cancer remains a major health challenge in India, ranking as the seventh most common cancer with over 64,000 new cases diagnosed annually, and the sixth leading cause of cancer-related deaths.
full_content:
AstraZeneca Pharma India on Wednesday said it has received approval from the national health regulator for Durvalumab in combination with chemotherapy for treatment of gastric or gastroesophageal junction cancer.
The Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) has granted approval for Durvalumab in combination with  FLOT chemotherapy (fluorouracil, leucovorin, oxaliplatin and docetaxel) as the first and only perioperative immunotherapy approach for adult patients with resectable gastric or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma.
Around half of gastric and gastroesophageal junction cancers are diagnosed at a resectable stage, where surgery combined with peri-operative chemotherapy is the standard of care.
Despite treatment with FLOT, five-year survival remains below 50 per cent, and recurrence rates are high within two years of surgery, underscoring the need for more effective peri-operative options.
"Patients with resectable gastric and gastroesophageal junction cancers face high recurrence risk. Backed by the MATTERHORN study, this approval brings immunotherapy earlier in the treatment pathway, significantly improving survival," AstraZeneca Pharma India  Country President and MD Praveen Rao Akkinepally said in a statement.
Gastric cancer remains a major health challenge in India, ranking as the seventh most common cancer with over 64,000 new cases diagnosed annually, and the sixth leading cause of cancer-related deaths.
Published on  February 4, 2026

headline: HCLTech to digitise Hong Kong Aero Engine Services’ MRO systems
condensed_text:
Dado Ruvic
Hong Kong Aero Engine Services Ltd (HAESL) has chosen Indian IT firm HCLTech to modernise its maintenance, repair and overhaul operations. The partnership aims to streamline HAESL's Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) processes to boost efficiency and scalability, provide real-time data visibility for quicker decision-making, improve resource utilisation and ensure compliance with global standards. HCLTech will deploy its asset management solution, iMRO/4, as HAESL's Maintenance Execution System (MES) in Hong Kong, HCLTech said in a statement. "By integrating iMRO/4 with SAP S/4HANA, we will enhance end -to- end traceability and provide a single view of the workflow from induction to release. "Partnering with HCLTech marks a significant step in our transformation, creating a scalable digital foundation that supports operational excellence and long -term growth ,” said Ravinder Bedi, General Manager of Finance & Administration, HAESL.
full_content:
Hong Kong Aero Engine Services Ltd (HAESL) has selected Indian IT firm HCLTech to modernise its maintenance, repair and overhaul operations.
Dado Ruvic
Hong Kong Aero Engine Services Ltd (HAESL) has chosen Indian IT firm HCLTech to modernise its maintenance, repair and overhaul operations.
The partnership aims to streamline HAESL's Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) processes to boost efficiency and scalability, provide real-time data visibility for quicker decision-making, improve resource utilisation and ensure compliance with global standards.
HCLTech will deploy its asset management solution, iMRO/4, as HAESL's Maintenance Execution System (MES) in Hong Kong, HCLTech said in a statement.
"By integrating iMRO/4 with SAP S/4HANA, we will enhance end -to- end traceability and provide a single view of the workflow from induction to release. This reduces barriers and improves execution efficiency.
"Partnering with HCLTech marks a significant step in our transformation, creating a scalable digital foundation that supports operational excellence and long -term growth ,” said Ravinder Bedi, General Manager of Finance & Administration, HAESL.

headline: Q3 Results impact: Bharat Coking Coal, Kansai Nerolac Paints shares fall up to 7%, Sheela Foam rallies 20%
condensed_text:
Bharat Coking Coal Q3 Results:
Bharat Coking Coal on February 3 reported a net loss of Rs 23 crore for the October-December quarter of the ongoing FY26, as against a net profit of Rs 425 crore in corresponding quarter of the previous financial year. Bharat Coking Coal's net loss however has contracted around 57 percent sequentially from the Rs 52.99 crore net loss reported in July-September quarter of the same financial year. Its revenue from operations meanwhile rose nearly 25 percent year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 2,783 crore during the quarter under review, as against Rs 3,688 crore during the year-ago period. Kansai Nerolac Paints Q3 Results:
Kansai Nerolac Paintson February 3 reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 121.36 crore for the third quarter of the ongoing financial year 2026. Sheela Foam Q3 Results:
Sheela Foamreported a consolidated net profit of Rs 52.13 crore for the October-December quarter of the ongoing financial year 2026.
full_content:
The shares of Bharat Coking Coal extended losses on February 4 after the company released its results for the October-December quarter of the ongoing financial year 2026. Kansai Nerolac Paints also dropped around 3 percent.
Sheela Foam shares meanwhile rallied 20 percent to briefly hit the upper circuit at Rs 628.30 apiece.
Bharat Coking Coal Q3 Results:
Bharat Coking Coal on February 3 reported a net loss of Rs 23 crore for the October-December quarter of the ongoing FY26, as against a net profit of Rs 425 crore in corresponding quarter of the previous financial year.
Bharat Coking Coal's net loss however has contracted around 57 percent sequentially from the Rs 52.99 crore net loss reported in July-September quarter of the same financial year.
Its revenue from operations meanwhile rose nearly 25 percent year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 2,783 crore during the quarter under review, as against Rs 3,688 crore during the year-ago period. Expenses fell around 10 percent YoY to Rs 2,922.34 crore.
Bharat Coking Coal’sproduction fell around 11 percentYoY to Rs 8.90 million tonners, missing its target of 11.27 million tones. EBITDA declined around 84 percent to Rs 104.16 crore during the quarter under review.
The shares of the newly-listed company closed in the red on February 3 after Q3 results.
The shares of the company dropped 7 percent to hit an intraday low of Rs 36.10 apiece on Wednesday, before recovering some losses. At close, the stock was down nearly 3 percent at Rs 37.58 apiece.
Kansai Nerolac Paints Q3 Results:
Kansai Nerolac Paintson February 3 reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 121.36 crore for the third quarter of the ongoing financial year 2026. This marks an 82 percent YoY fall from the Rs 680.87 crore net profit reported in Q3 FY25.
The firm’s revenue from operations meanwhile rose over 3 percent YoY to Rs 1,981.99 crore during the quarter under review.
The shares of the company dropped around 3 percent to close at Rs 221.80 apiece.
Sheela Foam Q3 Results:
Sheela Foamreported a consolidated net profit of Rs 52.13 crore for the October-December quarter of the ongoing financial year 2026. This marked a 212 percent YoY increase from the Rs 16.71 crore net profit reported in Q3 FY25.
The firm’s revenue from operations meanwhile rose more than 11 percent to Rs 1,074.43 crore during the quarter under review.
The shares of the company briefly hit the 20 percent upper circuit before paring some gains. At close, the stock was up more than 14 percent at Rs 597.75 apiece.
The shares of rival Wakefit Innovations fell more than 1 percent.

On this route, the number of flights will be cut to three times per week from February 19.”This scale adjustment was originally planned to be introduced in the summer schedule 2026; however, it is being executed earlier to ensure reliability to the rest of IndiGo’s long-haul operations,” the statement said.Further, Delhi-London Heathrow services will be cut to four from five per week for the current winter schedule starting from February 9.IndiGo said the measures are being taken to avoid inconvenience to passengers due to misconnections and cascading delays.

headline: Sigachi blast case: HC grants bail to MD & CEO
condensed_text:
Managing Director & CEO, Sigachi Industries Amit Raj Sinha
NAGARA GOPAL
Telangana High Court has granted bail to Amit Raj Sinha, Managing Director & CEO in connection with the accident in the Hyderabad plant of the company on June 2025. Informing this in a release on Tuesday, the Hyderabad based company said: “This has been a period of deep sorrow and strain for everyone affected by the incident, especially the families who lost their loved ones and those who continue to recover from injuries. Our thoughts remain with them.’’
The company would continue to extend its full cooperation to the investigating authorities and the judicial process to ensure that the matter is addressed in a fair and transparent manner. “In addition to fulfilling our responsibilities toward those affected, we remain dedicated to strengthening safety systems and practices across our operations to ensure the ongoing well-being of our workforce and the community,’’ the Statement said. In an explosion at the company’s Pashamylaram factory in Sangareddy district, Hyderabad, 54 people lost thier lives and several injured on June 30 last year.
full_content:
Managing Director & CEO, Sigachi Industries Amit Raj Sinha
NAGARA GOPAL
Telangana High Court has granted bail to Amit Raj Sinha, Managing Director & CEO in connection with the accident in the Hyderabad plant of the company on June 2025.
Informing this in a release on Tuesday, the Hyderabad based company said: “This has been a period of deep sorrow and strain for everyone affected by the incident, especially the families who lost their loved ones and those who continue to recover from injuries. Our thoughts remain with them.’’
The company would continue to extend its full cooperation to the investigating authorities and the judicial process to ensure that the matter is addressed in a fair and transparent manner.
“In addition to fulfilling our responsibilities toward those affected, we remain dedicated to strengthening safety systems and practices across our operations to ensure the ongoing well-being of our workforce and the community,’’ the Statement said.
Sigachi Industries scrip gained 14.94 percent on the Bombay Stock Exchange to end at ₹23.70 on Wednesday.
In an explosion at the company’s Pashamylaram factory in Sangareddy district, Hyderabad, 54 people lost thier lives and several injured on June 30 last year.

headline: TeamLease Q3 net profit rises 47% on GCCs' demand for skilled staff; shares up 3%
condensed_text: Staffing firmTeamLease Servicesreported a nearly 47% surge in third-quarter profit on February 4, driven by demand from global capability centres (GCC) for specialised staff. Revenue from the general staffing business, which contributes to over 90% of the total, rose 1.2% and was impacted by insourcing by a client in the banking and financial services division, the company said. "Despite general slowness in the economy, our new logo acquisition is stable, including the GCC wins...Full impact of BFSI (banking, financial services and insurance) headcount loss will be absorbed by Q1FY27," Managing Director Ashok Reddy said in a statement. Analysts previously said that staffing firms will benefit in the medium to long term from new labour codes, as simplified compliance norms will help reduce administration costs and could lead to more formalisation of India's workforce, leading to increased business. TeamLease said its profit for the period was not impacted as the impact of the changes in labour codes for billable employees is recoverable from customers and doesn't impact its bottom line.
full_content:
Staffing firmTeamLease Servicesreported a nearly 47% surge in third-quarter profit on February 4, driven by demand from global capability centres (GCC) for specialised staff.
Its consolidated net profit rose to Rs 42 crore for the three months ended December 2025, from Rs 28.5 crore a year earlier.
Its shares jumped as much as 11.8% after the results, and closed up 3% at Rs 1,473 apiece.
GCCs, which are Indian hubs of international firms, require software, finance, and R&D personnel for their operations. These hubs currently employ more than 1.9 million people, according to government data, and are expanding their workforce.
The company's revenue from the specialised staffing division, its second-largest vertical, rose 32.5%, lifting total revenue by about 3% to Rs 3,013 crore.
Revenue from the general staffing business, which contributes to over 90% of the total, rose 1.2% and was impacted by insourcing by a client in the banking and financial services division, the company said. The general staffing vertical provides contractual roles across non-IT sectors, including manufacturing, retail and telecom.
"Despite general slowness in the economy, our new logo acquisition is stable, including the GCC wins...Full impact of BFSI (banking, financial services and insurance) headcount loss will be absorbed by Q1FY27," Managing Director Ashok Reddy said in a statement.
Last week, peer Quess Corp reported a 32% quarterly profit growth.
Analysts previously said that staffing firms will benefit in the medium to long term from new labour codes, as simplified compliance norms will help reduce administration costs and could lead to more formalisation of India's workforce, leading to increased business.
TeamLease said its profit for the period was not impacted as the impact of the changes in labour codes for billable employees is recoverable from customers and doesn't impact its bottom line.

headline: Suzlon Energy, Waaree, Siemens shares: What B&K Securities says on renewable energy theme
condensed_text: On the BESS front, standalone tariffs have dropped sharply from about Rs 280,000 per MW per month in early 2025 to around Rs 150,000 per MW per month recently. Several industry participants have reinforced that recent tariff discoveries in BESS and Green ammonia/hydrogen auctions should not be mistaken for the economic feasibility of these technologies until execution commences, as many of these auctions are experiencing aggressive bidding by participants, the brokerage noted. Grid stability and resilience will become an important theme in the coming decade This should be positive for Siemens Energy, GEV T&D and Hitachi Energy," B&K Securities adds. The company reiterated that renewable energy is essential for India’s long-term self-sufficiency, and wind remains a structurally important pillar given India’s resource abundance. Thyssenkrupp Industries India Thyssenkrupp is a leading provider of industrial boiler systems in India, offering full EPC solutions across large-scale thermal and process applications.
full_content:
At India Energy Week on 28 January 2026, B&K Securities engaged with companies in the clean energy sector, highlighting concerns over the economic viability of recent tariff outcomes. Aggressive bidding by smaller players in Green Ammonia, Hydrogen, and Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) auctions has led to prices considered unsustainable for profitable execution.
Discussions with Advait Energy and JSW Energy indicated that several government tenders, including the latest, are unlikely to be feasible for bidders under current conditions. On the BESS front, standalone tariffs have dropped sharply from about Rs 280,000 per MW per month in early 2025 to around Rs 150,000 per MW per month recently. This rapid decline may cause delays as power purchasers reconsider previously contracted prices in light of lower tariffs.
B&K Securities noted the risk of a 'winner’s curse' and cautioned that these aggressive tariff levels could ultimately result in losses for developers unable to deliver profitably.
Another issue raised is the backlog of around 42 GW of solar Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) that remain unsigned, largely due to last-mile evacuation delays. The figure represents a cumulative build-up over years, mainly caused by delays in commissioning central transmission utility substations needed to connect projects to the main grid.
Tenders for renewable generation and grid substations are often awarded separately, and any delay in substation commissioning leads to cost overruns. Developers may have to rely on higher-cost state transmission networks, costs that distribution companies are unwilling to bear. Despite these challenges, B&K Securities emphasised that structural demand for renewables remains strong, though grid bottlenecks and aggressive pricing continue to pose hurdles.
Several industry participants have reinforced that recent tariff discoveries in BESS and Green ammonia/hydrogen auctions should not be mistaken for the economic feasibility of these technologies until execution commences, as many of these auctions are experiencing aggressive bidding by participants, the brokerage noted.
"Clean energy continues to be the talk of the town, with many companies keen on reducing their carbon emissions and decarbonising their processes. Grid stability and resilience will become an important theme in the coming decade This should be positive for Siemens Energy, GEV T&D and Hitachi Energy," B&K Securities adds.
Suzlon Energy Suzlon Energy is India’s largest wind turbine OEM and is positioned to benefit from the country’s accelerating wind energy deployment. The company reiterated that renewable energy is essential for India’s long-term self-sufficiency, and wind remains a structurally important pillar given India’s resource abundance.
The S144 turbine platform has been designed specifically to generate electricity efficiently even in low-wind zones, expanding the addressable market. The company expects installations to reach ~1,500 units in FY27, implying a strong growth ramp-up. Suzlon believes that larger MW turbines will drive further technological improvement by enhancing efficiency and addressing land-scarcity constraints.
Waaree Clean Energy Solutions Waaree is expanding into the green hydrogen ecosystem through electrolyser manufacturing, positioning itself early in an emerging decarbonization value chain. It believes green hydrogen adoption is still at a nascent stage, although hydrogen remains a fundamental input across industrial processes.
The company expects green hydrogen economics to converge toward parity with grey hydrogen over the next few years, enabling broader adoption. Waaree has entered into a technology tie-up with a Chinese partner and is currently focused on manufacturing alkaline electrolysers, given their inherent cost advantage over PEM systems.
Siemens Energy India Siemens Energy India is a critical supplier of FACTS systems and grid-stabilisation technologies that will become increasingly essential as renewable penetration rises. STATCOM demand is currently concentrated in the Gujarat-Rajasthan renewable corridor. Management estimates that every 1 GW of renewable addition requires roughly 300 MVAr of STATCOM capacity to stabilise grid operations.
Praj Industries Praj Industries is expanding from ethanol into renewable chemicals, bioplastics and SAF technology licencing. It demonstrated Poly-lactic acid (PLA) technology through a 100 tpa lactic acid plant and is offering this as a licensable solution. Balrampur Chini Mills is the first large-scale customer, licencing Praj’s technology for ~55 tpa lactic acid production.
Torrent Electricals Torrent Electricals is scaling rapidly in the HV/EHV cable segment, supported by structural transmission capex tailwinds. The company is venturing aggressively into HV and EHV cables and is already gaining market share in these categories. Cables remain a scale-driven business, where margins are largely determined by raw material procurement discipline and operating leverage.
ReNew Energy Global ReNew is among India’s largest renewable IPPs with a diversified operating portfolio across solar, wind and hydro. It is increasingly scaling its upstream manufacturing presence to strengthen integration and reduce import dependence. It currently operates 11 GW of renewable capacity and has another 8-9 GW under-construction, providing strong multi-year growth visibility.
Thyssenkrupp Industries India Thyssenkrupp is a leading provider of industrial boiler systems in India, offering full EPC solutions across large-scale thermal and process applications. It primarily focuses on industrial boilers ranging from 50 TPH to 1,000 TPH, with demand coming largely from industrial processes and chemical industries.
Solar Turbines Solar Turbines is a global leader in mid-sized industrial gas turbines, with strong relevance in distributed energy and industrial captive power applications. It manufactures gas turbines in the 1-35 MW range and holds a leading global market position in this segment. Management indicated that the US remains the primary market for Solar Turbines.
Advait Energy Advait Energy is participating in early-stage green hydrogen tenders, though economics remain immature and pricing highly competitive. It has executed a 300-kW electrolyser plant for PGCIL with limited margin buffer – highlighting challenging project economics in the green hydrogen ecosystem.

headline: Suzlon Energy, Waaree, Siemens shares: What B&K Securities says on renewable energy theme
condensed_text: On the BESS front, standalone tariffs have dropped sharply from about Rs 280,000 per MW per month in early 2025 to around Rs 150,000 per MW per month recently. Several industry participants have reinforced that recent tariff discoveries in BESS and Green ammonia/hydrogen auctions should not be mistaken for the economic feasibility of these technologies until execution commences, as many of these auctions are experiencing aggressive bidding by participants, the brokerage noted. Grid stability and resilience will become an important theme in the coming decade This should be positive for Siemens Energy, GEV T&D and Hitachi Energy," B&K Securities adds. The company reiterated that renewable energy is essential for India’s long-term self-sufficiency, and wind remains a structurally important pillar given India’s resource abundance. Thyssenkrupp Industries India Thyssenkrupp is a leading provider of industrial boiler systems in India, offering full EPC solutions across large-scale thermal and process applications.
full_content:
At India Energy Week on 28 January 2026, B&K Securities engaged with companies in the clean energy sector, highlighting concerns over the economic viability of recent tariff outcomes. Aggressive bidding by smaller players in Green Ammonia, Hydrogen, and Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) auctions has led to prices considered unsustainable for profitable execution.
Discussions with Advait Energy and JSW Energy indicated that several government tenders, including the latest, are unlikely to be feasible for bidders under current conditions. On the BESS front, standalone tariffs have dropped sharply from about Rs 280,000 per MW per month in early 2025 to around Rs 150,000 per MW per month recently. This rapid decline may cause delays as power purchasers reconsider previously contracted prices in light of lower tariffs.
B&K Securities noted the risk of a 'winner’s curse' and cautioned that these aggressive tariff levels could ultimately result in losses for developers unable to deliver profitably.
Another issue raised is the backlog of around 42 GW of solar Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) that remain unsigned, largely due to last-mile evacuation delays. The figure represents a cumulative build-up over years, mainly caused by delays in commissioning central transmission utility substations needed to connect projects to the main grid.
Tenders for renewable generation and grid substations are often awarded separately, and any delay in substation commissioning leads to cost overruns. Developers may have to rely on higher-cost state transmission networks, costs that distribution companies are unwilling to bear. Despite these challenges, B&K Securities emphasised that structural demand for renewables remains strong, though grid bottlenecks and aggressive pricing continue to pose hurdles.
Several industry participants have reinforced that recent tariff discoveries in BESS and Green ammonia/hydrogen auctions should not be mistaken for the economic feasibility of these technologies until execution commences, as many of these auctions are experiencing aggressive bidding by participants, the brokerage noted.

Waaree has entered into a technology tie-up with a Chinese partner and is currently focused on manufacturing alkaline electrolysers, given their inherent cost advantage over PEM systems.

headline: Rekha Jhunjhunwala earns₹858 crore from Titan after India-US trade deal
condensed_text: In just two days, one of Rekha Jhunjhunwala's portfolio stocks, Titan Company shares, have surged from ₹ 3,953.20 to ₹ 4,135.10 apiece on the NSE, logging a gain of ₹ 181.90 in the two sessions. Interestingly, LIC also owns 2,23,24,301 Titan Company shares, and the insurance behemoth of India has earned around ₹ 406 crore from the rally in this jewellery stock after the announcement of the India-US trade deal. After the announcement of the India-US trade deal, which is expected to benefit gems and jewellery stocks, Titan's share price skyrocketed from ₹ 3953.20 per share on the NSE to ₹ 4135.10, logging a net rise of ₹ 181.90 per share. As Rekha Jhunjhunwala owns 4,71,84,470 Titan Company shares, the total rise in Rekha Jhunjhunwala's net worth due to the rise in Tata Company shares is ₹ 8,58,28,55,093 or around ₹ 858 crore ( ₹ 181.90 x 4,71,84,470). As the Titan share price rose by ₹ 181.90 per share, the net rise in LIC's portfolio due to this Tata Group's jewellery stock is ₹ 406 crore ( ₹ 181.90 x 2,23,24,301).
full_content:
Rekha Jhunjhunwala portfolio: The Indian stock market has been on an uptrend after the announcement of the most-awaited India-US trade deal . The key benchmark index, Nifty 50, almost hit a new peak on Tuesday, rising to 26,341. The Indian indices are also on the higher side on Wednesday. In these two days of a positive trend, ace Indian investor Rekha Jhunjhunwala's portfolio also saw a big upside. In just two days, one of Rekha Jhunjhunwala's portfolio stocks, Titan Company shares, have surged from ₹ 3,953.20 to ₹ 4,135.10 apiece on the NSE, logging a gain of ₹ 181.90 in the two sessions. This ₹ 181.90 per share rise in this Tata Group's jewellery stock has fueled Rekha Jhunjhunwala's net worth by around ₹ 858 crore.
Interestingly, LIC also owns 2,23,24,301 Titan Company shares, and the insurance behemoth of India has earned around ₹ 406 crore from the rally in this jewellery stock after the announcement of the India-US trade deal.
According to the shareholding pattern of Titan Company Ltd for the October to December 2025 quarter, Rekha Jhunjhunwala owns company shares in her personal capacity. She owns 4,71,84,470 Titan Company shares, representing 5.31% of the company's paid-up capital.
After the announcement of the India-US trade deal, which is expected to benefit gems and jewellery stocks, Titan's share price skyrocketed from ₹ 3953.20 per share on the NSE to ₹ 4135.10, logging a net rise of ₹ 181.90 per share.
As Rekha Jhunjhunwala owns 4,71,84,470 Titan Company shares, the total rise in Rekha Jhunjhunwala's net worth due to the rise in Tata Company shares is ₹ 8,58,28,55,093 or around ₹ 858 crore ( ₹ 181.90 x 4,71,84,470).
It would be interesting to know that the Indian insurance behemoth Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) also owns shares in Titan Company. According to Titan Company Ltd's shareholding pattern for the Q3FY26 quarter, LIC owns 2,23,24,301 Titan shares. As the Titan share price rose by ₹ 181.90 per share, the net rise in LIC's portfolio due to this Tata Group's jewellery stock is ₹ 406 crore ( ₹ 181.90 x 2,23,24,301).

headline: City Union Bank targets mid-teen loan growth, stays cautious on unsecured lending
condensed_text: N Kamakodi, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of City Union Bank, says the bank is positioning itself for sustained mid-to-high teen loan growth over the coming quarters, led by secured lending across micro, small and medium enterprises , gold loans, agriculture and secured retail, while remaining cautious on unsecured expansion as it prioritises balance-sheet stability.The forward momentum is supported by a strong operating performance in the October-December quarter of 2025 , with net interest income rising 28% year-on-year to ₹752 crore, pre-provision operating profit up 17.7% at ₹513 crore and profit after tax  growing 16.1% to ₹332 crore.The bank’s market capitalisation stands at about ₹21,643.30 crore, and its shares have gained close to 66% over the past one year.Below are the edited excerpts from the interview.Q: You have given the street a guidance of growing in the mid to high teens, 15% to 20%, kind of growth. And specifically, in unsecured, how much headroom do you have, given some of the asset quality pressures that lenders have been telling us seem to have abated?A: We have always concentrated more on the secured front, starting with the MSMEs, commercial trading, and we added secured retail, particularly housing loans, loan against the property , rental discounting and all.So, from 2024 onwards, we have started building up the team, and around the end of the calendar year , we were able to see growth improving. And we have not gone in a significant way, unsecured retail, so far, and that strategy will stay for many more quarters to come before, if at all, we see on that line.Also Read: Budget 2026 | PSU bank mergers, capital rule changes on the table as India aims for bigger global banks: DFS SecretaryBut as of now, we are going purely on secured lending on MSMEs, commercial trading, gold loans and agriculture, along with now the secured retail of, let’s say, housing loans, LAP and other things.So, we feel we are spending some time on setting up the team. So, could you give us a sense of margins, based on all these factors?A: As you rightly said, we started fixed-rate gold loans a year before last, and the entire gold loan portfolio has, by and large, converted into a fixed-rate portfolio already. As we discussed in the con-call, over the next two to three quarters, whatever term deposits are maturing and repricing at lower rates, we will get the benefit to compensate for whatever yield reduction is happening on the asset side because of the repo cut.So overall, we are confident that whatever margin we currently have is sustainable, with a plus or minus 10 basis points.Q: The credit-deposit  ratio is at 86%, are you comfortable with that and your guidance for what kind of deposit growth would you have?A: The deposit growth will definitely be in tune with the credit growth, so that there will not be any stoppage in credit because of the non-availability of deposits.
full_content: N Kamakodi, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of City Union Bank, says the bank is positioning itself for sustained mid-to-high teen loan growth over the coming quarters, led by secured lending across micro, small and medium enterprises , gold loans, agriculture and secured retail, while remaining cautious on unsecured expansion as it prioritises balance-sheet stability.The forward momentum is supported by a strong operating performance in the October-December quarter of 2025 , with net interest income rising 28% year-on-year to ₹752 crore, pre-provision operating profit up 17.7% at ₹513 crore and profit after tax  growing 16.1% to ₹332 crore.The bank’s market capitalisation stands at about ₹21,643.30 crore, and its shares have gained close to 66% over the past one year.Below are the edited excerpts from the interview.Q: You have given the street a guidance of growing in the mid to high teens, 15% to 20%, kind of growth. What will drive that? And specifically, in unsecured, how much headroom do you have, given some of the asset quality pressures that lenders have been telling us seem to have abated?A: We have always concentrated more on the secured front, starting with the MSMEs, commercial trading, and we added secured retail, particularly housing loans, loan against the property , rental discounting and all.So, from 2024 onwards, we have started building up the team, and around the end of the calendar year , we were able to see growth improving. So, we had 21% growth for Q3 on a YoY basis. And we have not gone in a significant way, unsecured retail, so far, and that strategy will stay for many more quarters to come before, if at all, we see on that line.Also Read: Budget 2026 | PSU bank mergers, capital rule changes on the table as India aims for bigger global banks: DFS SecretaryBut as of now, we are going purely on secured lending on MSMEs, commercial trading, gold loans and agriculture, along with now the secured retail of, let’s say, housing loans, LAP and other things.So, we feel we are spending some time on setting up the team. And we never had a concept of a sales team in our bank in the past. It’s only in the last couple of years that we have been verticalising these business lines, and the sales units and all are now set, and they have started delivering.In fact, we said a year before last that last year it would make a loss. And for 2025-26 , it would start breaking even. And then from next year onwards, it would start adding to profitability. In fact, it has started adding to profitability this year, slightly ahead of whatever we had.Q: Margins were a key positive in this result as well. How much of that is sustainable, because part of it is because of your gold loans being made fixed-rate? How much repricing is left? And even deposit repricing is something you have done. So, could you give us a sense of margins, based on all these factors?A: As you rightly said, we started fixed-rate gold loans a year before last, and the entire gold loan portfolio has, by and large, converted into a fixed-rate portfolio already. So, we do not expect any shock.At the same time, the repo rate cut pass-through happened only towards the end of the quarter. So, the impact because of that will be slightly higher in terms of reduction in yields on advances.Also Read: Chola Securities backs PSU banks, cautious on private lenders and midcap cementAt the same time, it will get compensated. As we discussed in the con-call, over the next two to three quarters, whatever term deposits are maturing and repricing at lower rates, we will get the benefit to compensate for whatever yield reduction is happening on the asset side because of the repo cut.So overall, we are confident that whatever margin we currently have is sustainable, with a plus or minus 10 basis points.Q: The credit-deposit  ratio is at 86%, are you comfortable with that and your guidance for what kind of deposit growth would you have?A: The deposit growth will definitely be in tune with the credit growth, so that there will not be any stoppage in credit because of the non-availability of deposits. Consistently, we have maintained that we are comfortable with a CD ratio of about 85% to 86%, and we are in that range currently.Watch the interview in the accompanying videoCatch all the latest updates from the stock market here

headline: Global Health Q3 Results: Net profit falls 33% on margin compression
condensed_text: Global Health Ltd, which operates hospitals under the Medanta brand, on Wednesday  reported a 33.6% year-on-year decline in net profit to ₹95 crore for the third quarter, compared with ₹143 crore in the same period last year.Revenue rose 18.8% year-on-year to ₹1,121 crore from ₹943.3 crore. EBITDA margin stood at 19.4% in the quarter, compared with 25.2% in the corresponding period last year.Global Health's board has approved the appointment of Malik Mohd. Ashhab as Senior Management Personnel of the company, designated as Head–Diagnostic Services.Also Read: Budget 2026: Global Health, Aster DM rise up to 5% post FM's medical tourism pushThe board also recommended certain proposals to shareholders for their consideration and approval. These include the re-appointment of Dr Ravi Gupta as an Independent Director for a second term of five consecutive years with effect from July 8, 2026.In addition, the Board recommended the re-appointment of Rajan Bharti Mittal as an Independent Director for a second term of five consecutive years with effect from July 8, 2026. The Board further recommended the appointment of Shonan Purie Trehan as a Non-Executive Non-Independent Director of the company, liable to retire by rotation, with effect from March 13, 2026.Shares of Global Health Ltd ended at ₹1,127.00, up by ₹13.00, or 1.17%, on the BSE.Also Read: Global Health Q2 profit up 21% YoY; to expand Mumbai hospital to 750 beds
full_content: Global Health Ltd, which operates hospitals under the Medanta brand, on Wednesday  reported a 33.6% year-on-year decline in net profit to ₹95 crore for the third quarter, compared with ₹143 crore in the same period last year.Revenue rose 18.8% year-on-year to ₹1,121 crore from ₹943.3 crore. EBITDA fell 8.3% to ₹217.8 crore from ₹237.5 crore on a year-on-year basis. EBITDA margin stood at 19.4% in the quarter, compared with 25.2% in the corresponding period last year.Global Health's board has approved the appointment of Malik Mohd. Ashhab as Senior Management Personnel of the company, designated as Head–Diagnostic Services.Also Read: Budget 2026: Global Health, Aster DM rise up to 5% post FM's medical tourism pushThe board also recommended certain proposals to shareholders for their consideration and approval. These include the re-appointment of Dr Ravi Gupta as an Independent Director for a second term of five consecutive years with effect from July 8, 2026.In addition, the Board recommended the re-appointment of Rajan Bharti Mittal as an Independent Director for a second term of five consecutive years with effect from July 8, 2026. The Board further recommended the appointment of Shonan Purie Trehan as a Non-Executive Non-Independent Director of the company, liable to retire by rotation, with effect from March 13, 2026.Shares of Global Health Ltd ended at ₹1,127.00, up by ₹13.00, or 1.17%, on the BSE.Also Read: Global Health Q2 profit up 21% YoY; to expand Mumbai hospital to 750 beds

headline: Mahindra Lifespace lines up ₹8,000 crore launches to power FY27 pre-sales
condensed_text: Mahindra Lifespace Developers, the real estate and infrastructure development arm of the Mahindra Group, plans to launch multiple residential projects over the next few months as it targets higher pre-sales in the next financial year 2026-27 , according to Managing Director and CEO Amit Kumar Sinha.Sinha said the company is preparing two to three major launches in the next three months. Sinha said, “We’ve given guidance of ₹4,500 to ₹5,000 crore for our pre-sales.”The company reported its earnings for the October–December 2025 quarter, supported by a recovery in residential sales and demand in its industrial and integrated cities business.Mahindra Lifespace currently has a market capitalisation of ₹7,970.49 crore. So, one of them is Mahindra Blossom.Also Read | Hyundai Motor India plans to lift exports share to 30% of production by FY30We are expecting a couple of other launches to come through, but more importantly, for the launches that we did in the early part of the year, as well as the phase launches of the previous projects, which will give us growth momentum. We are pushing hard to get them sooner, but this is very important, because for the next year, I've given guidance of ₹4,500 to ₹5,000 crore for our pre-sales on the residential side, and that's something that we are looking forward to by having these launches lined up in the early part of the next financial year. So, it hasn't been a very significant shift on the inventory overhang side, but there are certain pockets and segments where you see a slowdown.Also Read | Nazara Technologies says core business improving, more acquisitions on radarThe second is that we need to be clear where we play, and it's good that we are present in Mumbai, Pune and Bengaluru.The third part is, as things slow down — and we expect some part of it to happen and then get corrected over a longer period — there is a shift towards branded developers, and quality developers who have a multi-year track record, who have always met customer expectations, and delivered projects on time in line with expectations.
full_content: Mahindra Lifespace Developers, the real estate and infrastructure development arm of the Mahindra Group, plans to launch multiple residential projects over the next few months as it targets higher pre-sales in the next financial year 2026-27 , according to Managing Director and CEO Amit Kumar Sinha.Sinha said the company is preparing two to three major launches in the next three months. The company expects launches worth about ₹7,000 to ₹8,000 crore towards the end of the fourth quarter of 2025-26  and the start of the first quarter of the next financial year 2026-27.The company said launch timelines may move slightly as project approvals and schedules get finalised. Sinha said, “Exact launch dates are not yet known.” He said the company is working to bring launches forward where possible.Mahindra Lifespace has guided for residential pre-sales of about ₹4,500 to ₹5,000 crore in the next financial year. The company said early launches will help support sales momentum. Sinha said, “We’ve given guidance of ₹4,500 to ₹5,000 crore for our pre-sales.”The company reported its earnings for the October–December 2025 quarter, supported by a recovery in residential sales and demand in its industrial and integrated cities business.Mahindra Lifespace currently has a market capitalisation of ₹7,970.49 crore. The company’s shares have declined by more than 1% over the past year.These are the edited excerpts of the interview.Q: There's an increase in quarter three bookings and volumes as well. But if I look at the nine-month sales, they have come in at ₹1,773 crore. FY25 sales were at ₹2,800 crore. Do you think you'll be able to surpass last year's bookings, considering that the quarterly run rate so far has been around ₹500 crore?A: We will be able to surpass our last year's numbers and hopefully show growth. Some part of that is driven by the launches. We had, as an example, a very successful launch of a project called Mahindra Blossom in Whitefield, Bengaluru, and in the three days of the last weekend, it did more than ₹1,000 crore itself. So, we are hoping to see growth driven by some of these launches. So, one of them is Mahindra Blossom.Also Read | Hyundai Motor India plans to lift exports share to 30% of production by FY30We are expecting a couple of other launches to come through, but more importantly, for the launches that we did in the early part of the year, as well as the phase launches of the previous projects, which will give us growth momentum. We see opportunities across all our markets — Mumbai, Bengaluru, and Pune. And these launches are just evidence to show that there is momentum in the market for our kind of products, for our value proposition.Q: Could you quantify these launch numbers for us? And how much in Q4, and how much would come in FY27?A: We are looking at maybe two to three big launches coming in the next three months, and I'm not constraining it by the end of the financial year, because sometimes launches spill over the March 31 deadline. But we have roughly anywhere from ₹7,000 to ₹8,000 crore worth of launches that are going to happen towards the end of quarter four and the start of quarter one.Combining some of that — exact dates and exact launch dates are not yet known. We are pushing hard to get them sooner, but this is very important, because for the next year, I've given guidance of ₹4,500 to ₹5,000 crore for our pre-sales on the residential side, and that's something that we are looking forward to by having these launches lined up in the early part of the next financial year. Hopefully, some of the quarter four launches will have a positive effect on the pre-sales velocity next year.Q: The big talking point, of course, has to be demand trends. The realty index is coming off the 52-week high. Many stocks are at lows as well. Do you think we are towards the latter part of the real estate upcycle?A: I wish I knew the perfect answer to that. But let me give you three points here. The first point is that there are some signs of moderation in the market, especially in certain segments and certain micro markets or specific cities. For example, in NCR, we see a significant slowdown. We see a slowdown in the luxury segment. There are markets that have this characteristic.But overall, if you look at inventory overhang — how much inventory is there in the market that customers can buy — it has moved up only 10%, from 13 months to now close to 15 months. That means if no new launches are coming into the market, all the inventory that is there will get absorbed in 15 months. It was 13 months two years back. So, it hasn't been a very significant shift on the inventory overhang side, but there are certain pockets and segments where you see a slowdown.Also Read | Nazara Technologies says core business improving, more acquisitions on radarThe second is that we need to be clear where we play, and it's good that we are present in Mumbai, Pune and Bengaluru.The third part is, as things slow down — and we expect some part of it to happen and then get corrected over a longer period — there is a shift towards branded developers, and quality developers who have a multi-year track record, who have always met customer expectations, and delivered projects on time in line with expectations. And suppliers like us tend to stand out well.For the full interview, watch the accompanying videoCatch all the latest updates from the stock market here

headline: Trent Q3 Results: Operating profit growth beats estimates, margin expands
condensed_text: Tata Group retail firm Trent Ltd on Wednesday  reported a 2.7% year-on-year rise in net profit for Q3 at ₹510 crore, compared with ₹496.5 crore in the same period last year, slightly below CNBC-TV18’s poll estimate of ₹537 crore.Revenue grew 14.8% to ₹5,345 crore from ₹4,656 crore a year ago. EBITDA margin improved to 20.2% from 18.2% in Q3 last year.Trent now operates a significant portfolio of over 1,100 “large-box” fashion stores, with a presence across 274 cities. In Q3FY26, the company opened 17 Westside and 48 Zudio stores, including one store in the UAE.As of December 31, 2025, the store portfolio comprised 278 Westside stores, 854 Zudio stores , and 32 stores across other lifestyle concepts. The gross margin profile of Westside and Zudio remained stable, while the operating EBIT margin for Q3FY26 was 13.8%, up from 13.2% in Q3FY25.Trent’s Star business consisted of 79 stores during the nine months ended December 31, 2025, including the addition of six stores and the closure of five. The company is implementing multiple interventions, including technology upgrades, aimed at enhancing differentiation and improving convenience for its customers.Shares of Trent ended 5.2% higher on Wednesday, ahead of the earnings announcement at ₹4,021.
full_content: Tata Group retail firm Trent Ltd on Wednesday  reported a 2.7% year-on-year rise in net profit for Q3 at ₹510 crore, compared with ₹496.5 crore in the same period last year, slightly below CNBC-TV18’s poll estimate of ₹537 crore.Revenue grew 14.8% to ₹5,345 crore from ₹4,656 crore a year ago. EBITDA jumped 27.6% year-on-year to ₹1,081.7 crore, surpassing CNBC-TV18’s poll of ₹1,000 crore. EBITDA margin improved to 20.2% from 18.2% in Q3 last year.Trent now operates a significant portfolio of over 1,100 “large-box” fashion stores, with a presence across 274 cities. In Q3FY26, the company opened 17 Westside and 48 Zudio stores, including one store in the UAE.As of December 31, 2025, the store portfolio comprised 278 Westside stores, 854 Zudio stores , and 32 stores across other lifestyle concepts. The total retail footprint across Trent’s fashion brands exceeded 15 million sq. ft.The company stated that full-year results are more representative of the health of the business due to its approach to merchandise sourcing, price architecture, distribution, and inventory provisioning. The gross margin profile of Westside and Zudio remained stable, while the operating EBIT margin for Q3FY26 was 13.8%, up from 13.2% in Q3FY25.Trent’s Star business consisted of 79 stores during the nine months ended December 31, 2025, including the addition of six stores and the closure of five. The company is implementing multiple interventions, including technology upgrades, aimed at enhancing differentiation and improving convenience for its customers.Shares of Trent ended 5.2% higher on Wednesday, ahead of the earnings announcement at ₹4,021. The stock is down over 40% from its peak of ₹8,345 in October 2024.

headline: Anthropic-led AI volatility an opportunity for IT services, says Happiest Minds’ Ashok Soota
condensed_text: Recent global rout in IT stocks, triggered by fears that advanced artificial intelligence tools could disrupt traditional services models, should be viewed as an opportunity rather than a threat, said Ashok Soota, Chairman and Chief Mentor of Happiest Minds Technologies. A veteran of India’s IT industry, Soota previously founded Mindtree and earlier played a key role in scaling Wipro’s IT services business. He added, in a statement, that the growing excitement around AI platforms and plug-ins may lower the entry barrier for building software, but it does not diminish the role of IT services firms. “As an AI First company, we welcome this development,” Soota said in a statement, adding that innovations in enterprise AI reinforce the role of IT services in guiding organisations through large-scale technology transformation. While AI platforms act as accelerators, he said, real value is created only when these tools are embedded into core business processes and aligned with security, compliance and industry regulations.
full_content:
Recent global rout in IT stocks, triggered by fears that advanced artificial intelligence tools could disrupt traditional services models, should be viewed as an opportunity rather than a threat, said Ashok Soota, Chairman and Chief Mentor of Happiest Minds Technologies.
Indian IT stocks have seen sharp selling in recent sessions, mirroring a global technology rout after AI startup Anthropic unveiled new enterprise capabilities for its Claude platform.
The selloff has been driven by investor concerns that AI-led automation could compress timelines and reduce dependence on large, services-led delivery models.
A veteran of India’s IT industry, Soota previously founded Mindtree and earlier played a key role in scaling Wipro’s IT services business.
He added, in a statement, that the growing excitement around AI platforms and plug-ins may lower the entry barrier for building software, but it does not diminish the role of IT services firms. Instead, it increases the need for partners that can handle enterprise-grade integration, governance, orchestration and managed services.
“As an AI First company, we welcome this development,” Soota said in a statement, adding that innovations in enterprise AI reinforce the role of IT services in guiding organisations through large-scale technology transformation.
Drawing parallels with earlier disruptions such as SaaS and cloud computing, Soota said every major technology shift has historically expanded the scope of IT services.
While AI platforms act as accelerators, he said, real value is created only when these tools are embedded into core business processes and aligned with security, compliance and industry regulations.

headline: Welspun Enterprises Q3 profit tumbles 66% as sales dip, cost control lifts margins
condensed_text: Welspun Enterprises Ltd reported a sharp decline in profitability for the third quarter, with consolidated net profit falling 65.6% year-on-year to ₹26.7 crore, compared with ₹77.5 crore in the same quarter last year.Revenue for the quarter declined 12.2% year-on-year to ₹787 crore from ₹896 crore. EBITDA margin expanded to 19.6% during the quarter, compared with 17.6% in the corresponding period last year.The Q3 performance reflects pressure on topline and profitability on a year-on-year basis, even as margins improved, indicating better cost control relative to revenue during the period.Q2 performance snapshotIn contrast to the Q3 outcome, Welspun Corp Ltd had delivered a strong performance in the second quarter. The company reported a 53.2% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit to ₹439 crore, compared with ₹287 crore in the same period last year.Revenue in Q2 rose 32.5% year-on-year to ₹4,373 crore from ₹3,301.8 crore. EBITDA margin for the quarter stood at 13.5%, up from 12.1% in the corresponding period last year.During the quarter, Welspun Corp announced the acquisition of 2.72 crore equity shares, representing a 4.11% stake in Welspun Specialty Solutions Ltd, from the promoter group at market price, subject to regulatory approvals. Upon completion, its equity holding in the subsidiary will rise from 51.06% to 55.17%.The company also announced plans to incorporate a wholly owned subsidiary in the Dubai International Financial Centre, UAE, to act as an investment holding company for global investments, subject to necessary approvals.Also read: Welspun Corp Q2 net profit jumps 53% to ₹439 crore, revenue surges 33%Shares of Welspun Enterprises Limited ended 0.60% higher on the NSE at ₹471.05 on 04 February 2026.
full_content: Welspun Enterprises Ltd reported a sharp decline in profitability for the third quarter, with consolidated net profit falling 65.6% year-on-year to ₹26.7 crore, compared with ₹77.5 crore in the same quarter last year.Revenue for the quarter declined 12.2% year-on-year to ₹787 crore from ₹896 crore. Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation  slipped 2% to ₹154.2 crore, as against ₹157.3 crore a year earlier. Despite the drop in revenue and EBITDA, operating performance saw some improvement at the margin level. EBITDA margin expanded to 19.6% during the quarter, compared with 17.6% in the corresponding period last year.The Q3 performance reflects pressure on topline and profitability on a year-on-year basis, even as margins improved, indicating better cost control relative to revenue during the period.Q2 performance snapshotIn contrast to the Q3 outcome, Welspun Corp Ltd had delivered a strong performance in the second quarter. The company reported a 53.2% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit to ₹439 crore, compared with ₹287 crore in the same period last year.Revenue in Q2 rose 32.5% year-on-year to ₹4,373 crore from ₹3,301.8 crore. EBITDA increased 47.7% to ₹590.8 crore from ₹400 crore a year ago. EBITDA margin for the quarter stood at 13.5%, up from 12.1% in the corresponding period last year.During the quarter, Welspun Corp announced the acquisition of 2.72 crore equity shares, representing a 4.11% stake in Welspun Specialty Solutions Ltd, from the promoter group at market price, subject to regulatory approvals. Upon completion, its equity holding in the subsidiary will rise from 51.06% to 55.17%.The company also announced plans to incorporate a wholly owned subsidiary in the Dubai International Financial Centre, UAE, to act as an investment holding company for global investments, subject to necessary approvals.Also read: Welspun Corp Q2 net profit jumps 53% to ₹439 crore, revenue surges 33%Shares of Welspun Enterprises Limited ended 0.60% higher on the NSE at ₹471.05 on 04 February 2026.

headline: Trent Q3 results: Net profit rises to Rs 510 crore; revenue jumps 15% to Rs 5,345 crore
condensed_text: Trent Ltd , the retail arm of the Tata Group, on Wednesday reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 510.11 crore for the third quarter ended December 31, 2025. The company had posted a net profit of Rs 496.54 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal, a growth of roughly 3 per cent year-on-year. The company’s revenue from operations witnessed a double-digit rise, at Rs 5,345.06 crore, a 15 per cent jump compared to Rs 4,656.56 crore recorded in the same period last year. "The customer sentiment is gradually improving and our business outlook for the medium term continues to remain positive," said Noel N Tata, Chairman, Trent. As of December 31, 2025, the company’s store portfolio included 278 Westside stores and 854 Zudio stores, including a growing presence in the UAE.
full_content:
Trent Ltd , the retail arm of the Tata Group, on Wednesday reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 510.11 crore for the third quarter ended December 31, 2025. The company had posted a net profit of Rs 496.54 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal, a growth of roughly 3 per cent year-on-year.
The company’s revenue from operations witnessed a double-digit rise, at Rs 5,345.06 crore, a 15 per cent jump compared to Rs 4,656.56 crore recorded in the same period last year. In its exchange filing, the retail giant highlighted that its operating EBITDA grew by 20 per cent to Rs 837 crore.
"The customer sentiment is gradually improving and our business outlook for the medium term continues to remain positive," said Noel N Tata, Chairman, Trent.
"Our focus continues to be on portfolio growth, elevating products and enhancing store experience for our customers," he added.
As of December 31, 2025, the company’s store portfolio included 278 Westside stores and 854 Zudio stores, including a growing presence in the UAE. During the quarter alone, the company opened 17 Westside and 48 Zudio stores, further cementing its footprint in the fashion retail segment. Meanwhile, on Wednesday, shares of Trent rose 4.98% to settle at Rs 4013.20 apiece.

headline: Emcure Pharma net profit jumps 48% in Q3FY26 on strong international business growth
condensed_text: Emcure Pharmaceuticalsposted a 48 percent year‑on‑year jump in net profit for the December quarter, led by strong international business momentum and improving operating leverage, even as the company absorbed a one‑time labour‑code related expense. Profit after tax rose to Rs 231 crore in Q3FY26 from Rs.156 crore a year earlier, despite an exceptional expense of Rs 38 crore linked to labour code changes. The company’s international sales—now representing more than half its revenue—rose 24.5 percent YoY to Rs 1,338 crore, with every major geography reporting double‑digit growth. A major contributor this quarter was the launch of Poviztra, a biological injectable semaglutide licensed from Novo Nordisk, giving Emcure a foothold in India’s fast‑growing weight‑management and obesity‑care market. “The Novo Nordisk partnership has given Emcure an early‑entry advantage, positioning us well in the fast‑growing obesity segment,” Mehta said.
full_content:
Emcure Pharmaceuticalsposted a 48 percent year‑on‑year jump in net profit for the December quarter, led by strong international business momentum and improving operating leverage, even as the company absorbed a one‑time labour‑code related expense.
Profit after tax rose to Rs 231 crore in Q3FY26 from Rs.156 crore a year earlier, despite an exceptional expense of Rs 38 crore linked to labour code changes. The bottom‑line surge outpaced revenue growth as operating margins expanded and finance costs dropped.
Revenue from operations grew 20.4 percent to Rs 2,363 crore, with gains across both domestic and overseas markets. EBITDA rose 27.2 percent to Rs 460 crore, lifting margins to 19.5 percent, up 103 basis points from the prior year.
CEO Satish Mehta said all businesses “outpaced industry growth,” adding that Emcure continues to invest in its differentiated global pipeline while focusing on profitability.
The company’s international sales—now representing more than half its revenue—rose 24.5 percent YoY to Rs 1,338 crore, with every major geography reporting double‑digit growth.
Rest of World (RoW) was up 30.7 percent, driven by both antiretroviral (ARV) and non‑ARV segments.
Europe rose 29.6 percent, supported by the rollout of Manx and Amphotericin B, while Canada: grew 12.8 percent, maintaining steady momentum.
Mehta highlighted that the differentiated portfolio and new launches are helping Emcure deliver above‑market performance across international markets.
Domestic sales grew 15.4 percent to Rs 1,025 crore, led by chronic therapies such as cardiovascular and diabetes, and supported by new initiatives.
A major contributor this quarter was the launch of Poviztra, a biological injectable semaglutide licensed from Novo Nordisk, giving Emcure a foothold in India’s fast‑growing weight‑management and obesity‑care market.
“The Novo Nordisk partnership has given Emcure an early‑entry advantage, positioning us well in the fast‑growing obesity segment,” Mehta said.

headline: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank’s Q3FY26 net profit rises 14%
condensed_text:
Salee S Nair, MD & CEO, Tamilnad Mercantile Bank Ltd
Tamilnad Mercantile Bank on Wednesday reported a 14 per cent rise in net profit at ₹342 crore for the quarter that ended December 2025 (Q3FY26). The quarterly profit growth was driven by a 16 per cent year-on-year (y-o-y) rise in advances,  on the back of MSME loans and fixed-rate gold loans, which also helped improve yield on advances. “We are on a transformation journey, and have seen growth momentum further accelerating in this quarter with growth in total business, profitability and reaching highest-ever quarterly net profit levels,” Salee S Nair, MD & CEO, Tamilnad Mercantile Bank Ltd, told media persons. A robust 60 per cent+ growth in personal gold loans portfolio (secured), which help shield banks from the impact of ‘repo rate cuts’ have also helped, he noted. Among other digital initiatives, helping the bank improve CASA and collections, TMB said it has established a “state-of-the-art Call Centre with AI calling facility” to enhance customer service and support capabilities.
full_content:
Salee S Nair, MD & CEO, Tamilnad Mercantile Bank Ltd
Tamilnad Mercantile Bank on Wednesday reported a 14 per cent rise in net profit at ₹342 crore for the quarter that ended December 2025 (Q3FY26). Total income for Q3 stood at ₹1,655 crore, compared to ₹1,520 crore in the same quarter last year.
The quarterly profit growth was driven by a 16 per cent year-on-year (y-o-y) rise in advances,  on the back of MSME loans and fixed-rate gold loans, which also helped improve yield on advances. Total advances as of December 2025 stood at ₹50,763 crore.
Deposits grew 12.5 per cent y-o-y to ₹56,707 crore. Total business grew by 14.3 per cent y-o-y to ₹1,07,470 crore as of December 2025. The bank also saw a healthy CASA increase to ₹15,847 crore with a growth rate of 14.9 per cent on y-o-y basis.
“We are on a transformation journey, and have seen growth momentum further accelerating in this quarter with growth in total business, profitability and reaching highest-ever quarterly net profit levels,” Salee S Nair, MD & CEO, Tamilnad Mercantile Bank Ltd, told media persons. For full fiscal FY26, the bank expects to grow total business by over 15 per cent, a tad higher than their original guidance.
The MSME loan segment growth, especially, has been a “turnaround story”, said the MD and CEO. We expect the recent US and EU trade deals as a definite boost to this segment, he added. A robust 60 per cent+ growth in personal gold loans portfolio (secured), which help shield banks from the impact of ‘repo rate cuts’ have also helped, he noted.
On the asset quality front, Gross NPA has decreased to 0.91 per cent in Q3FY26 from 1.32 per cent in Q3FY25. Net NPA has decreased to 0.20 per cent, improved by 21 bps y-o-y.
Among other digital initiatives, helping the bank improve CASA and collections, TMB said it has established a “state-of-the-art Call Centre with AI calling facility” to enhance customer service and support capabilities. We expect to set aside around ₹250 crore for technology modernisation and digital transformation in FY27, along the same lines as FY26, Nair said.
Based on the bank’s preliminary assessment, it does not see the incremental impact of new Labour Codes to be material on the finances, and accordingly no provision is considered for the quarter.
Published on  February 4, 2026
BACK TO TOP

headline: Broker’s call: Akzo Nobel (Add)
condensed_text:
Target: ₹3,200
CMP: ₹2,889.30
We like Akzo Nobel India’s (to be renamed as JSW Dulux Ltd) strategy to increase investments in strengthening brand building and trade relationships. While there was impact on volumes in H1FY26 due to trade  disruption post transition in ownership/management, we note the company has managed to recover in Q3 and reported  strong volume growth. There could be  realisation of synergy benefits over FY27-28E of about 2-3 per cent of net sales, and we model partial re-investment of savings in brand building, trade spends and distribution. We model Akzo to report revenue and PAT CAGRs of 2.1 per cent and 4.1 per cent, respectively, over FY25–28E. We maintain Add with a DCF-based revised target price of ₹3,200 (₹3,500 previously); implied target P/E of 30x FY28E).
full_content:
Target: ₹3,200
CMP: ₹2,889.30
We like Akzo Nobel India’s (to be renamed as JSW Dulux Ltd) strategy to increase investments in strengthening brand building and trade relationships. It has invested the savings from reduction in royalty in price cuts, additional spends  to strengthen relations with trade as well as corporates and multiple new product launches.
We note its domestic decorative volume growth (LFL) was 8 per cent y-o-y in Q3-FY26. While there was impact on volumes in H1FY26 due to trade  disruption post transition in ownership/management, we note the company has managed to recover in Q3 and reported  strong volume growth. We model it to be more aggressive now on driving revenue growth/market share. There could be  realisation of synergy benefits over FY27-28E of about 2-3 per cent of net sales, and we model partial re-investment of savings in brand building, trade spends and distribution. We remain constructive.
We model Akzo to report revenue and PAT CAGRs of 2.1 per cent and 4.1 per cent, respectively, over FY25–28E. There is potential for stronger revenue growth as the company may re-invest synergy benefits in driving volume growth. We maintain Add with a DCF-based revised target price of ₹3,200 (₹3,500 previously); implied target P/E of 30x FY28E).
Key risks: Higher-than-expected competitive pressures and steep inflation in commodity prices
Published on  February 4, 2026
