headline: JSW Cement shares jump 9% after Q3 turnaround from loss to profit, expansion updates
condensed_text:
Shares of JSW Cement surged as much as 9% in Thursday’s trade following its turnaround financial performance for Q3 FY26, where the company reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 130.62 crore, reversing a loss in the corresponding quarter last fiscal. As per the stock exchange filing, JSW Cement reported a consolidated net profit attributed to the owners of the company of Rs 130.62 crore for quarter ended December 31, 2025, from the consolidated net loss of Rs 80.22 crore recorded in the same period last year. \
The company’s consolidated revenue from operations for the quarter stood at Rs 1,621.22 crore, from Rs 1,432.74 crore in the same period last year. The company attributed this growth primarily to operating leverage, noting that its operating EBITDA margin improved to 17.6% versus 15.1% in Q3 FY25. The company also confirmed that the first phase of its Nagaur Integrated Unit in Rajasthan, comprising 3.30 MTPA clinker and 2.50 MTPA grinding capacity, is on track for commissioning in the current quarter (Q4 FY26).
full_content:
Shares of JSW Cement surged as much as 9% in Thursday’s trade following its turnaround financial performance for Q3 FY26, where the company reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 130.62 crore, reversing a loss in the corresponding quarter last fiscal.
At 12:18 pm, JSW Cement shares were trading up 8.61% at Rs 126.15. The stock rallied 9.34% to touch the day’s high of Rs 127 against its previous close of Rs 116.15 on the BSE.
As per the stock exchange filing, JSW Cement reported a consolidated net profit attributed to the owners of the company of Rs 130.62 crore for quarter ended December 31, 2025, from the consolidated net loss of Rs 80.22 crore recorded in the same period last year. \
The company’s consolidated revenue from operations for the quarter stood at Rs 1,621.22 crore, from Rs 1,432.74 crore in the same period last year.
The company reported an operating EBITDA of Rs 285.1 crore, marking a robust 32% jump compared to the previous year. The company attributed this growth primarily to operating leverage, noting that its operating EBITDA margin improved to 17.6% versus 15.1% in Q3 FY25.
The total volume sold climbed 14% YoY to 3.56 million tonnes (MT). This growth was driven by a 7% rise in cement volumes and a substantial 17% increase in Ground Granulated Blast Furnace Slag (GGBS) sales.
The company’s board approved the incorporation of a wholly-owned subsidiary in Fujairah, UAE. The new entity will set up a cement grinding unit with a capacity of 1.65 million tonnes per annum (MTPA), the company informed exchanges.
The project entails a capital expenditure of approximately USD 39 million, which will be funded through a mix of debt and equity, it said.
The company also greenlit a corporate guarantee of up to USD 29.25 million to secure foreign currency term loans for the new subsidiary.
The company also confirmed that the first phase of its Nagaur Integrated Unit in Rajasthan, comprising 3.30 MTPA clinker and 2.50 MTPA grinding capacity, is on track for commissioning in the current quarter (Q4 FY26).
Additionally, regulatory approvals are currently in progress for its proposed 2.75 MTPA split grinding unit in Mansa, Punjab.
Copyright © 2026 Living Media India Limited. For reprint rights: Syndications Today. India Today Group.

headline: Hexaware CEO says slowdown temporary, growth to pick up after March
condensed_text: The latest quarter also saw one-time impacts, including lower spending from a large client and higher furlough levels during the period.The company reported weak operational performance in the October–December 2025 period, with sequential revenue decline and margins coming below estimates.He believes some of the Q4 pressures will continue into the January-March 2026 quarter. The company’s shares have declined more than 18% over the past year.These are the edited excerpts of the interview.Q: Explain to us first what led to the decline in revenue in Q4, and second, you're saying that the company is going through an unusually weak period, seasonality aside, explain to us what it means for Q1.A: Q4 was not what we expected. But just coming back to the one-offs that impacted your revenue in Q4, could you put a number to it?A: So, there were two, and, I'll say between the two, it impacted 60 to 70 bps of growth.Also Read | Mahindra Lifespace lines up ₹8,000 crore launches to power FY27 pre-salesQ: Now, the big worry is these agentic artificial intelligence  developments from many of these big tech companies are going to put pressure not just on software companies, package implementation companies, but even the IT outsourcing companies which help with the implementation of this packaged software, the application development and maintenance, which is a fair amount of IT services revenues, ADM, as we call it, and that will cause revenue deflation. Then the last step is generating the code, which is easier, but in aggregate, it is still a lot of work and a lot of spending, which went into the licence fee that will get translated to custom software development and agentic development.Also Read | Pidilite sees strong push from renovation and construction chemicalsQ: What's the extent of deflation seen in the legacy traditional business?A: Whenever a customer is going through a process of saying, okay, now let's do it in a new way, and often it's at the point of renewal, it could be 20–40% depending on the type of work.But not all of this is happening on day one or at a given point in time. Given this deflationary impact that we are seeing, do you think getting back to double digit is going to be hard for the next three years?A: So, we said, while this is the guidance that we called out essentially as a bottom, our core thesis of growing in the low teens and several accelerators to get us to mid to high teens remains completely intact.If you look at our history, every year that we've grown under 10%, the next two years have been outstanding growth.
full_content: Hexaware Technologies expects business growth to improve after the first quarter of calendar year 2026, following weak performance in the October-December 2025 quarter. R Srikrishna, CEO and Executive Director of Hexaware Technologies said seasonal factors, client spending cuts, and furloughs impacted recent numbers.Srikrishna said the December quarter was below internal expectations but remained broadly in line with seasonal trends. He said, “Q4 was not very much what we expected. It is always a seasonally weak quarter for us. If you look at several years, we have sequential declines in Q4.”He said revenue declines in Q4 have been consistent over multiple years. The latest quarter also saw one-time impacts, including lower spending from a large client and higher furlough levels during the period.The company reported weak operational performance in the October–December 2025 period, with sequential revenue decline and margins coming below estimates.He believes some of the Q4 pressures will continue into the January-March 2026 quarter. However, he said the outlook improves after the first quarter. “Some of what happened in Q4 is going to carry forward into Q1, but after that period, we expect that we will grow nicely and accelerate growth through every quarter in calendar 2026.”Hexaware currently has a market capitalisation of ₹38,173.22 crore. The company’s shares have declined more than 18% over the past year.These are the edited excerpts of the interview.Q: Explain to us first what led to the decline in revenue in Q4, and second, you're saying that the company is going through an unusually weak period, seasonality aside, explain to us what it means for Q1.A: Q4 was not what we expected. It is always a seasonally weak quarter for us. If you look at several years, we have sequential declines in Q4. There were some additional one-offs. There was one large client that had a reduction in the quarter. There were higher furloughs than expected in the quarter, but in aggregate, it is still not very different from what we expected.Now, we said we are going through a difficult Q1 and Q4. Q4 I already spoke about. Some of what happened in Q4 will carry forward into Q1, but after that period, we expect to grow nicely and accelerate growth through every quarter in calendar 2026.Q: So Q1 also sees a decline in revenue?A: It will be. Historically, again, Q1 is always a soft quarter for us. It is flattish.Q: So Q1 could be flattish historically, and this time should be no different. But just coming back to the one-offs that impacted your revenue in Q4, could you put a number to it?A: So, there were two, and, I'll say between the two, it impacted 60 to 70 bps of growth.Also Read | Mahindra Lifespace lines up ₹8,000 crore launches to power FY27 pre-salesQ: Now, the big worry is these agentic artificial intelligence  developments from many of these big tech companies are going to put pressure not just on software companies, package implementation companies, but even the IT outsourcing companies which help with the implementation of this packaged software, the application development and maintenance, which is a fair amount of IT services revenues, ADM, as we call it, and that will cause revenue deflation. Explain to us how you see the impact and what exactly is happening.A: So, first is we agree that packaged software can get replaced by agentic workflows and by cloud-native software. We agree. However, we see it as a very large opportunity for us for two reasons.One, we don't have too much legacy business in packaged software implementation. So whatever headwinds are there, they are very limited for us on that front.More importantly, three weeks ago, we were the first in the world to launch a service called Zero Licence. Zero Licence, essentially, as the name suggests, is a proposition to help our customers get off any licensed software, which includes Commercial Off-the-Shelf , packaged software, and Software as a Service .So, we agree with the thesis that they can be replaced. But we actually think it's a very large opportunity for Hexaware. We were the first in the world to launch a service specific to that.Q: Using AI, is it fundamentally, in a way, deflationary? The question is about pricing at the end of the day. Because you're replacing something. The industry was earning $100. Effort goes down by 25–30% in some cases, so that 100 is not 100, maybe it is 90, 80, 70, or 50. So what's the rate of growth from here we're looking at? That's the real question.A: So, both of what you said are correct.First is that for any piece of work that goes through transformation, it often happens at the point of rebid. There will be deflation. We said in an earnings call earlier today that in traditional services, there will be a deflationary impact, and we've accounted for that in the numbers we're talking about.On the other hand, there will be new services and new volumes that more than make up for it. Let me give you two examples of services we've launched that have new volumes.First, a year ago, we launched a service called Legacy Modernisation. This is to help modernise code written 70 years ago that nobody in the world knows anything about.Now, this is a problem that could not be solved without AI, and now customers are putting big budgets to solve for legacy. That's example one.Example two is the one that we just spoke about — SaaS. Think of that market. It's in hundreds of billions of dollars. That's all net new wallet. Because the code is not going to write itself. It's not just about the code. You have to understand the business processes that are encoded. How do you understand those business processes? Then the last step is generating the code, which is easier, but in aggregate, it is still a lot of work and a lot of spending, which went into the licence fee that will get translated to custom software development and agentic development.Also Read | Pidilite sees strong push from renovation and construction chemicalsQ: What's the extent of deflation seen in the legacy traditional business?A: Whenever a customer is going through a process of saying, okay, now let's do it in a new way, and often it's at the point of renewal, it could be 20–40% depending on the type of work.But not all of this is happening on day one or at a given point in time. So, in aggregate, because these tend to get staggered over a fairly long period of time in a given year, we think it will be like 2–3% deflation, and we accounted for that in how we think about our numbers.Q: And will this 2–3% annual deflationary impact that you're seeing today accelerate? Can that become 5–6% in the coming year?A: I think that the new services and the new kind of work — it's not going to go to everyone — but people who are focused on it, are agile, nimble, and have innovation to address the new areas, that will far exceed the deflation. So, in aggregate, we expect there will be net positive growth because of AI.Q: You have guided for this calendar year's growth to be better than last year, which is 7-7.5%. But you're a company which used to see double-digit growth, mid-teens, high-teens kind of revenue growth. Given this deflationary impact that we are seeing, do you think getting back to double digit is going to be hard for the next three years?A: So, we said, while this is the guidance that we called out essentially as a bottom, our core thesis of growing in the low teens and several accelerators to get us to mid to high teens remains completely intact.If you look at our history, every year that we've grown under 10%, the next two years have been outstanding growth. So, I don't expect a challenge in getting to double-digit growth in the future at all.For the full interview, watch the accompanying videoCatch all the latest updates from the stock market here

headline: Kaynes Tech Q3 Results: Topline may miss projections; FY26 guidance in focus
condensed_text: Kaynes Tech Q3 Results: Topline may miss projections; FY26 guidance in focus. Shares of Kaynes Technology  Ltd. are trading with losses of around 4% on Thursday, February 5, ahead of its third quarter results announcement later in the day.A CNBC-TV18 poll expects the company's revenue to grow by 50% during the quarter to ₹990 crore from ₹661 crore last year, led primarily by the automotive and industrial segment.However, if this number is reported, it will be lower than the guidance of ₹1,300 crore that the company had projected for during the quarter.Kaynes' Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation and Amortisation  may rise 67% on a year-on-year basis to ₹157 crore from 94 crore last year.EBITDA margin for the quarter may expand by 160 basis points from the same quarter last year to 15.8% from 14.2%. Margins may decline on a sequential basis, due to the steep discounts given by Chinese component manufacturers due to the decline in US tariffs.Net profit for the quarter is seen 62% higher from last year at ₹108 crore.A key factor to watch during the quarter will be the cash flow generation during the quarter, given that Kaynes had generated negative cash flow from operations in financial year 2025.JPMorgan expects the company's financial year 2026 revenue guidance to be cut down to ₹4,000 crore from ₹4,400 crore, while margin guidance may be maintained at 16%.Kaynes Tech shares are trading 3.8% lower on Thursday ahead of the results announcement at ₹3,633. The stock has snapped a two-day winning streak, during which it had gained nearly 10%. The stock is down along with its other EMS player, Dixon Tech, after Qualcomm's disappointing results and guidance overnight.
full_content: Shares of Kaynes Technology  Ltd. are trading with losses of around 4% on Thursday, February 5, ahead of its third quarter results announcement later in the day.A CNBC-TV18 poll expects the company's revenue to grow by 50% during the quarter to ₹990 crore from ₹661 crore last year, led primarily by the automotive and industrial segment.However, if this number is reported, it will be lower than the guidance of ₹1,300 crore that the company had projected for during the quarter.Kaynes' Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation and Amortisation  may rise 67% on a year-on-year basis to ₹157 crore from 94 crore last year.EBITDA margin for the quarter may expand by 160 basis points from the same quarter last year to 15.8% from 14.2%. Margins may decline on a sequential basis, due to the steep discounts given by Chinese component manufacturers due to the decline in US tariffs.Net profit for the quarter is seen 62% higher from last year at ₹108 crore.A key factor to watch during the quarter will be the cash flow generation during the quarter, given that Kaynes had generated negative cash flow from operations in financial year 2025.JPMorgan expects the company's financial year 2026 revenue guidance to be cut down to ₹4,000 crore from ₹4,400 crore, while margin guidance may be maintained at 16%.Kaynes Tech shares are trading 3.8% lower on Thursday ahead of the results announcement at ₹3,633. The stock has snapped a two-day winning streak, during which it had gained nearly 10%. The stock is down along with its other EMS player, Dixon Tech, after Qualcomm's disappointing results and guidance overnight.

headline: Amit Shah to launch India’s first cooperative ride-hailing app Bharat Taxi in Delhi today
condensed_text: The service is a government-backed cab aggregation platform based on a cooperative ownership model and is not directly operated by the Union government.Bharat Taxi, run by Sahakar Taxi Cooperative Limited, is registered under the Multi-State Cooperative Societies Act, 2002, and was established on June 6, 2025. The platform follows a zero-commission and surge-free pricing system with profits distributed directly to drivers.Drivers on the platform, called “Sarathis,” are shareholders in the cooperative. Amit Shah will distribute share certificates to them under the “Sarathi Hi Malik” principle.Each will receive personal accident insurance of ₹5 lakh and family health insurance of ₹5 lakh. More than 1,200 Sarathis are expected to attend.The ministry has described Bharat Taxi as the world’s first and largest cooperative-based ride-hailing platform and the largest driver-owned mobility platform. It added that over 3 lakh drivers and more than 1 lakh users have registered so far, with more than 10,000 rides being completed daily in the pilot regions.The statement said around ₹10 crore has been distributed directly to drivers to date.
full_content: Union Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah will launch ‘Bharat Taxi’ today at 3 PM at Vigyan Bhavan. The service is a government-backed cab aggregation platform based on a cooperative ownership model and is not directly operated by the Union government.Bharat Taxi, run by Sahakar Taxi Cooperative Limited, is registered under the Multi-State Cooperative Societies Act, 2002, and was established on June 6, 2025. The platform follows a zero-commission and surge-free pricing system with profits distributed directly to drivers.Drivers on the platform, called “Sarathis,” are shareholders in the cooperative. Instead of per-ride commissions, drivers pay a flat daily fee to use the app. The model is designed to increase driver earnings and reduce passenger fares.During today’s event, the top six Sarathis will be honoured. Amit Shah will distribute share certificates to them under the “Sarathi Hi Malik” principle.Each will receive personal accident insurance of ₹5 lakh and family health insurance of ₹5 lakh. Nine MoUs will be signed with public and private stakeholders. More than 1,200 Sarathis are expected to attend.The ministry has described Bharat Taxi as the world’s first and largest cooperative-based ride-hailing platform and the largest driver-owned mobility platform. The service plans to expand to all states and cities within two years and set up dedicated support centres in every state.Fares are estimated to be up to 30% lower than those of private aggregators. Savings from the zero-commission structure are expected to be passed on to passengers. This may increase price competition in city cab markets where Ola, Uber, and Rapido operate.An official statement said the service began pilot operations on December 2, 2025, in Delhi-NCR and Gujarat. It added that over 3 lakh drivers and more than 1 lakh users have registered so far, with more than 10,000 rides being completed daily in the pilot regions.The statement said around ₹10 crore has been distributed directly to drivers to date. Drivers are allowed to operate on other platforms and are not bound by exclusivity clauses. Support centres are functioning at seven locations in Delhi.The platform includes safety features such as verified driver records, emergency assistance, and a dedicated helpline. Bharat Taxi offers social security measures for drivers. These include health insurance, accident insurance, retirement savings support, and a structured assistance system.A women-focused service called “Bike Didi” has onboarded more than 150 women drivers. The cooperative is backed by major institutions in the sector. These include IFFCO, Amul, NCDC, NABARD, NDDB, KRIBHCO, NAFED, and NCEL.

headline: Metropolis Healthcare targets 13-15% revenue growth in FY26 on preventive and specialty push
condensed_text: Mumbai-based diagnostic service provider Metropolis Healthcare is confident of delivering revenue growth at the higher end of its medium-term guidance, backed by strong momentum in preventive testing and specialty diagnostics.C Surendran, Managing Director of Metropolis Healthcare, said the company’s recent performance reflects sustained demand strength and operational execution, positioning it to achieve 13–15% revenue growth in FY26 as these higher-value segments continue to scale.Metropolis Healthcare sees a clear path to margin expansion, particularly in its Core Diagnostics business. Rising awareness, improved affordability, and the ability to bundle diagnostic tests with consultations and wellness insights are helping Metropolis deepen customer engagement and improve realisations, supporting a steady expansion in these higher-margin segments.In October-December quarter , Metropolis Healthcare reported a revenue of ₹405.91 crore, profit of ₹41.39 crore and margins of 23%.Below are the edited excerpts of the conversation.Q: Your Truhealth and your specialty portfolio did record strong growth. How is the growth there?A: Let me talk about the smaller ones first, which is the Scientific Pathology, Dr. Ahuja's Pathology in Dehradun all of them are growing equal or better than the company growth in terms of revenue and their margins are better than the company levels of margins.Core Diagnostics, we have said in the first year our focus is basically the bigger integration that we have done. The next year could be a year of accelerating revenues as well as bringing margins above a two-digit number.Q: Are you in a position to take price hikes based on what you are seeing in your competitive environment, and if so, to the tune of how much and by when?A: Every year, we do a price increase in the month of January, but we haven't done this year the price increase because of the GST considerations, etc. Hence, we wanted to pass on the benefit to the consumer and we did not do a price increase this year.We believe that the market is conducive for price increase, and then can take a price hike, but we have not set any timelines for price increase, maybe at the appropriate time, we will look at the opportunity to take the price increase.Follow our live blog for more stock market updates
full_content: Mumbai-based diagnostic service provider Metropolis Healthcare is confident of delivering revenue growth at the higher end of its medium-term guidance, backed by strong momentum in preventive testing and specialty diagnostics.C Surendran, Managing Director of Metropolis Healthcare, said the company’s recent performance reflects sustained demand strength and operational execution, positioning it to achieve 13–15% revenue growth in FY26 as these higher-value segments continue to scale.Metropolis Healthcare sees a clear path to margin expansion, particularly in its Core Diagnostics business. With the integration phase nearing completion and non-core activities streamlined, the company expects double-digit margins in Core Diagnostics from next year, adding a fresh leg to earnings growth and improving overall operating leverage.Going forward, the company expects its TrueHealth preventive portfolio and specialty diagnostics to outpace overall growth. Rising awareness, improved affordability, and the ability to bundle diagnostic tests with consultations and wellness insights are helping Metropolis deepen customer engagement and improve realisations, supporting a steady expansion in these higher-margin segments.In October-December quarter , Metropolis Healthcare reported a revenue of ₹405.91 crore, profit of ₹41.39 crore and margins of 23%.Below are the edited excerpts of the conversation.Q: Your Truhealth and your specialty portfolio did record strong growth. Your Truhealth, which is preventive testing, which did well this quarter. In fact, it did see a growth of around 25% to ₹69 crores. And your specialty business, which is your core business, was up around 16% odd, which is around close to 40% of your total sales. What is leading and driving this growth? And is this kind of growth sustainable going forward?A: We had a very emphatic quarter, quarter three was one of the best performance we had in the recent past. The revenues were largely driven even by the Truhealth performance as well as the specialty. Now, what's happening on the Truhealth is, the overall awareness about the preventive health is increasing in the country.We have created a bigger market now, and the affordability is improving. And of course, your ability to bundle the products and create value for the customers in terms of getting their basic vital test done, ECG done, and do a doctor consultation along with a wellness report and all this is the value creation that we have done for the consumer. As a result, we are seeing continuous improvement in the Truhealth portfolio, now growing roughly about 25% for the organic business.On the specialty side, Metropolis always been a specialty company. All complex test you know, it's been done by Metropolis. We are improving our ability and capabilities, or doing more and more specialty tests, and the integration of Core Diagnostics have really helped us in creating a very high-end test capability on the oncology side. So all this is really helping us in terms of improving the overall realisation, and that's what we see in the quarter three results.Q: TruHealth and specialty diagnostics are currently driving growth and together account for about 40% of revenues, with growth of around 17%. How do you see the contribution of these segments evolving from here, and do you expect this share to increase further in FY27 and beyond?A: When the TruHealth and specialty is growing higher than the overall company level margin, these are the one which is really driving the growth. Hence their contribution will definitely keep improving as we go along. Our ability to convert a customer coming for a single test and then asking him or her to get a bundle test and some different test been done - that capability is also increasing. We clearly see that the TruHealth portfolio, as well as specialty will keep getting better as you go forward.Q: I understand that quarter three was impacted by some amount of seasonality. What are you expecting in quarter four when it comes to see organic growth?A: We have beaten the seasonality in quarter three. Quarter three, normally used to be a softer quarter, and if you seen the results of many other companies in diagnostic space, the quarter three has not been very strong. However, some proactive action that we have taken at the beginning of quarter three has helped us to beat the seasonality. We have delivered a very good performance and in quarter three.For us, the overall estimate for the year is always been about 12 to 13% revenue growth, and we are very sure about delivering the higher-end of that band that we talked about, 12 to 13%. It could be a little higher than 13% for the full year basis for the revenue growth.Q: What about your key acquisitions, how they performed during the quarter? Organic growth 15%, but Core Diagnostics, Scientific Pathology, Dr. Ahuja's Pathology - how has all these performed for the company? How is the growth there?A: Let me talk about the smaller ones first, which is the Scientific Pathology, Dr. Ahuja's Pathology in Dehradun all of them are growing equal or better than the company growth in terms of revenue and their margins are better than the company levels of margins.Core Diagnostics, we have said in the first year our focus is basically the bigger integration that we have done. Our focus is to get the integration completed and clean up all the businesses, which we really don't want to do, and focus more on, margin improvement in year one. So, that progress, as per our stated objectives, are getting better.As we are coming close to this year, we are definitely in a position to achieve our objectives we set out for the Core Diagnostics. The next year could be a year of accelerating revenues as well as bringing margins above a two-digit number.Q: Are you in a position to take price hikes based on what you are seeing in your competitive environment, and if so, to the tune of how much and by when?A: Every year, we do a price increase in the month of January, but we haven't done this year the price increase because of the GST considerations, etc. that we could get. Hence, we wanted to pass on the benefit to the consumer and we did not do a price increase this year.We believe that the market is conducive for price increase, and then can take a price hike, but we have not set any timelines for price increase, maybe at the appropriate time, we will look at the opportunity to take the price increase.Follow our live blog for more stock market updates

headline: JSW Cement Q3 profit at ₹130.62 crore, revenue up 13.15% to ₹1,621.2 crore
condensed_text: JSW Cement Ltd has reported a profit of ₹130.62 crore for the December quarter of FY26, helped by improvement in EBITDA and gains in sales volume. The company had reported a loss of ₹80.22 crore for the October-December quarter a year ago, according to a regulatory filing from JSW Cement, part of the $23 billion JSW group, on late Wednesday evening. Revenue from operations of the company was up 13.15 per cent to ₹1,621.22 crore in the December quarter of FY26 on a year to year basis. Its total volume sales were up 3.56 per cent to 3.56 Million Tonne (MT) in Q3/FY26, from 3.12 MT in the corresponding quarter of FY25. Its "Combined cost of inputs increased slightly on a YoY basis, primarily driven by higher blended fuel consumption cost and an increase in inter-plant transfer of raw materials," said JSW Cement.
full_content:
JSW Cement Ltd has reported a profit of ₹130.62 crore for the December quarter of FY26, helped by improvement in EBITDA and gains in sales volume.
The company had reported a loss of ₹80.22 crore for the October-December quarter a year ago, according to a regulatory filing from JSW Cement, part of the $23 billion JSW group, on late Wednesday evening.
JSW Cement has reported an exceptional item (net loss) of ₹33.66 crore in the December quarter, mainly due to the implementation of the new Labour Codes.
Its profit before exceptional items and tax was at ₹217.95 crore in the quarter under review.
Revenue from operations of the company was up 13.15 per cent to ₹1,621.22 crore in the December quarter of FY26 on a year to year basis. It was at ₹1,432.74 crore in the corresponding quarter a year ago.
Its revenue increases "primarily driven by volume increase," said JSW Cement in its earnings presentations.
Its "Operating EBITDA improved 31.5 per cent YoY to ₹285.1 crore, equating to ₹802/MT," the company said.
Its total volume sales were up 3.56 per cent to 3.56 Million Tonne (MT) in Q3/FY26, from 3.12 MT in the corresponding quarter of FY25.
However, its Cement realisation in Q3 declined by 3.9 per cent on Quarter on Quarter basis, said JSW Cement in its investor's presentation.
Total expenses of the company were at ₹1,504.10 crore, up 1.52 per cent in the third quarter of FY26.
Its "Combined cost of inputs increased slightly on a YoY basis, primarily driven by higher blended fuel consumption cost and an increase in inter-plant transfer of raw materials," said JSW Cement.
JSW Cement's total income, which includes other income of the company, was up 16.84 per cent to ₹1,707.36 crore in the December quarter.  Its net debt was at ₹3,557 crore in the December quarter.
While updating Capex, JSW Cement said in Q3 FY26, the company incurred ₹491 crore.
As of December 31, 2025, the company had a cement grinding capacity of 21.60 MTPA (million tonne per annum).
It aims to reach 41.85 MTPA of grinding capacity along with 13.04 MTPA of clinker capacity with a pan-India presence.
Published on  February 5, 2026
BACK TO TOP

headline: PVR Inox Q3 Results: Profit zooms 166% YoY to₹96 crore; revenue up 9%
condensed_text: PVR Inox Q3 Results: Cinema chain operator PVR Inox announced a massive 166.5% year-on-year (YoY) jump in its consolidated net profit for the third quarter of the ongoing fiscal on Thursday, February 5. The earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA), excluding the impact of ₹ 44.6 crore provision arising from the change in Labour Code, came in at ₹ 662.1 crore as against ₹ 569.5 crore a year-ago. PVR Inox, in a press release, stated that for the second consecutive quarter, the business delivered EBITDA margins of ~18% at occupancies of 28%+, compared to the pre-COVID period when similar margins were achieved at 350–400 bps higher occupancies. The company's performance was supported by a healthier genre mix and a more consistent release slate led by a few large tentpole releases, including Dhurandhar, which has emerged as the highest-grossing Hindi film of all time with a cumulative box office of ₹ 1,000 crore. In Q3 FY26, PVR Inox added 20 screens and exited three underperforming screens, while for the nine months of the fiscal, it added 62 screens (FOCO and asset light) and exited 11 loss-making screens.
full_content:
PVR Inox Q3 Results: Cinema chain operator PVR Inox announced a massive 166.5% year-on-year (YoY) jump in its consolidated net profit for the third quarter of the ongoing fiscal on Thursday, February 5.
The consolidated profit in Q3 FY26 stood at ₹ 95.7 crore as against ₹ 35.9 crore a year ago. However, on a quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) basis, the profit after tax (PAT) was lower by 9.4% from ₹ 105.7 crore posted during the September quarter.
Meanwhile, the revenue from operations on a consolidated basis came in at ₹ 1,879.8 crore, a growth of 9% as against ₹ 1,717.3 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The figure was largely unchanged against ₹ 1,823 crore posted in the preceding quarter of FY26.
The earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA), excluding the impact of ₹ 44.6 crore provision arising from the change in Labour Code, came in at ₹ 662.1 crore as against ₹ 569.5 crore a year-ago.
PVR Inox, in a press release, stated that for the second consecutive quarter, the business delivered EBITDA margins of ~18% at occupancies of 28%+, compared to the pre-COVID period when similar margins were achieved at 350–400 bps higher occupancies.
"This underscores the enduring benefits of merger synergies and structural cost optimisation, resulting in a more resilient and efficient operating model," said the company.
The company's performance was supported by a healthier genre mix and a more consistent release slate led by a few large tentpole releases, including Dhurandhar, which has emerged as the highest-grossing Hindi film of all time with a cumulative box office of ₹ 1,000 crore.
In Q3 FY26, PVR Inox added 20 screens and exited three underperforming screens, while for the nine months of the fiscal, it added 62 screens (FOCO and asset light) and exited 11 loss-making screens. The company said it remains on track to add 90–100 new screens in FY26.
“Under its Capital Light growth strategy, the company now has 149 screens signed, of which 54 screens are under the FOCO model and 95 screens under the Asset-light model,” the company said.
More to come…

headline: Hindustan Copper share price extends fall, slides 6%; down 24% from recent peak
condensed_text: State-owned Hindustan Copper witnessed another round of selling pressure in Thursday’s session, with the stock falling 6% to the day’s low of ₹ 577.60 apiece, as the sell-off in the counter deepened amid a twin blow of falling copper prices and a strengthening US dollar. Copper prices joined a broader rout across asset classes, including precious metals, with benchmark three-month copper on the LME dropping another 1% to $12,925 a ton amid concerns over rising supplies from China. A 12,750-tonne inflow into LME’s Asian warehouses in Taiwan and South Korea brought on-warrant copper stocks registered with the exchange to 155,725 tonnes, the highest level since March. At the same time, Beijing’s Nonferrous Metals Industry Association has forecast that the country’s refined copper output is likely to rise by about 5% this year, following a 10% surge last year, according to media reports. Elsewhere, markets are also focusing on the US plan for strategic stockpiling of critical minerals to counter China’s dominance, with the latest step announced on Wednesday to marshal allies into a preferential trade bloc and propose coordinated price floors.
full_content:
State-owned Hindustan Copper witnessed another round of selling pressure in Thursday’s session, with the stock falling 6% to the day’s low of ₹ 577.60 apiece, as the sell-off in the counter deepened amid a twin blow of falling copper prices and a strengthening US dollar.
Copper prices joined a broader rout across asset classes, including precious metals, with benchmark three-month copper on the LME dropping another 1% to $12,925 a ton amid concerns over rising supplies from China.
On Tuesday, copper had surged nearly 4.55% in its best one-day gain since November 2022, driven by a broad rebound in metals after a historic drop. However, rising inventories have tested demand for the red metal, which is widely used in construction and electrification.
Inventories in London Metal Exchange warehouses in Asia have also been rising, testing the rally of the red metal. A 12,750-tonne inflow into LME’s Asian warehouses in Taiwan and South Korea brought on-warrant copper stocks registered with the exchange to 155,725 tonnes, the highest level since March.
Copper inventories in SHFE warehouses have also been rising since December, totalling 133,004 tonnes on Friday, the highest level since April, Reuters reported, citing the exchange’s weekly stock report.
At the same time, Beijing’s Nonferrous Metals Industry Association has forecast that the country’s refined copper output is likely to rise by about 5% this year, following a 10% surge last year, according to media reports.
Further, the purchases from Chinese fabricators and manufacturers slowed for a second consecutive day on Wednesday, as businesses prepare for the Lunar New Year holidays.
In addition to rising copper supplies, the strengthening US dollar has weighed on greenback-denominated commodities by making them less affordable for investors using other currencies.
The dollar index strengthened above 97.5 on Thursday, scaling a near two-week high, as markets priced in a slower pace of potential Federal Reserve rate cuts.
Elsewhere, markets are also focusing on the US plan for strategic stockpiling of critical minerals to counter China’s dominance, with the latest step announced on Wednesday to marshal allies into a preferential trade bloc and propose coordinated price floors.
The shares have retreated sharply from recent highs, falling 24% over seven trading sessions, as the relentless rally prompted investors to lock in some gains, while falling copper prices also hurt sentiment.
Between September and January, the stock gained 200%, which also helped it close 2025 with a 110% gain, the biggest yearly gain since 2023.
(With inputs from Reuters)

headline: Jan Suraaj seeks fresh Bihar polls, flags alleged MCC violations in Supreme Court
condensed_text: Jan Suraaj, the political outfit launched by election strategist Prashant Kishor and touted as a disruptive force ahead of the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections, has knocked on the doors of the Supreme Court, challenging the outcome of the polls on the grounds of alleged corrupt practices by the ruling party.As per a report by Live Law, the party has filed a writ petition under Article 32 of the Constitution, challenging the Bihar Assembly elections, 2025, alleging illegal practices and seeking fresh polls. Despite contesting 238 seats, Jan Suraaj failed to win a single seat in the election.At the heart of the challenge is the Bihar government’s decision to add fresh beneficiaries under the Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana and transfer ₹10,000 directly to women voters while the Model Code of Conduct was allegedly in force. The petition claims that direct benefit transfers were made to around 25–35 lakh women voters during the election period.A bench comprising Chief Justice of India Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi is scheduled to hear the matter tomorrow.The petition seeks a declaration that the addition of beneficiaries and the payments made during the subsistence of the Model Code of Conduct were illegal and violative of Articles 14, 21, 112, 202 and 324 of the Constitution. It also urges the Election Commission of India to initiate action under Article 324 of the Constitution and Section 123 of the Representation of the People Act, which deals with corrupt practices.Jan Suraaj has further challenged the deployment of nearly 1.8 lakh women associated with the JEEVIKA self-help group at polling booths during both phases of voting, arguing that the move was illegal and compromised the fairness of the electoral process.Alongside seeking fresh Assembly elections in Bihar on account of the alleged corrupt practices, the petition asks the Election Commission to implement the Supreme Court’s directions in S. Subramaniam Balaji v. State of Tamil Nadu  9 SCC 659. It has urged the Election Commission to prescribe a minimum implementation period—preferably six months—for schemes with electoral impact before the announcement of an election schedule.The legal challenge comes against the backdrop of Jan Suraaj’s electoral underperformance in a contest where it was widely discussed as a potential third force but failed to make a mark at the ballot box.
full_content: Jan Suraaj, the political outfit launched by election strategist Prashant Kishor and touted as a disruptive force ahead of the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections, has knocked on the doors of the Supreme Court, challenging the outcome of the polls on the grounds of alleged corrupt practices by the ruling party.As per a report by Live Law, the party has filed a writ petition under Article 32 of the Constitution, challenging the Bihar Assembly elections, 2025, alleging illegal practices and seeking fresh polls. Despite contesting 238 seats, Jan Suraaj failed to win a single seat in the election.At the heart of the challenge is the Bihar government’s decision to add fresh beneficiaries under the Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana and transfer ₹10,000 directly to women voters while the Model Code of Conduct was allegedly in force. The petition claims that direct benefit transfers were made to around 25–35 lakh women voters during the election period.A bench comprising Chief Justice of India Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi is scheduled to hear the matter tomorrow.The petition seeks a declaration that the addition of beneficiaries and the payments made during the subsistence of the Model Code of Conduct were illegal and violative of Articles 14, 21, 112, 202 and 324 of the Constitution. It also urges the Election Commission of India to initiate action under Article 324 of the Constitution and Section 123 of the Representation of the People Act, which deals with corrupt practices.Jan Suraaj has further challenged the deployment of nearly 1.8 lakh women associated with the JEEVIKA self-help group at polling booths during both phases of voting, arguing that the move was illegal and compromised the fairness of the electoral process.Alongside seeking fresh Assembly elections in Bihar on account of the alleged corrupt practices, the petition asks the Election Commission to implement the Supreme Court’s directions in S. Subramaniam Balaji v. State of Tamil Nadu  9 SCC 659. The ruling had flagged concerns around freebies and their impact on free and fair elections.The party has also sought directions for framing comprehensive guidelines on freebies, Direct Benefit Transfer schemes and welfare measures. It has urged the Election Commission to prescribe a minimum implementation period—preferably six months—for schemes with electoral impact before the announcement of an election schedule.The legal challenge comes against the backdrop of Jan Suraaj’s electoral underperformance in a contest where it was widely discussed as a potential third force but failed to make a mark at the ballot box.

headline: Suzlon Energy Q3 Results: Revenue growth of 42%, margin expands but stock falls 4%
condensed_text: Shares of Suzlon Energy Ltd. fell over 4% on Thursday, February 5, after the company reported its December quarter results, which were higher on a year-on-year basis.The company's net profit grew by 14.8% from the same quarter last year to ₹445.2 crore from ₹387 crore earlier.Its Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation and Amortisation  for the quarter increased by 48% to ₹730.5 crore from ₹493 crore during the same quarter last year.EBITDA margin for the quarter increased by 70 basis points to 17.3% from 16.6% last year.Revenue growth for the quarter stood at 42.4% year-on-year. Suzlon Energy reported revenue of ₹4,228.1 crore from ₹2,968 crore in the year-ago period.At the end of the quarter, Suzlon Energy had a record order book of 6.4 GW with the highest-ever quarterly deliveries at 617 MW. Execution of 2.4 GW worth of orders is currently underway.The company had a net cash position of ₹1,556 crore at the end of the December quarter. "Our closing order book of 6.4 GW stands higher than the opening orderbook for the quarter, despite the highest-ever deliveries in 30 years. The success of this shift is enhancing revenue visibility, improving project control, and will continue to be a big growth driver for the group," he added.For the first nine months of the year, Suzlon Energy's revenue has grown by 58% from the same period last year to ₹11,211 crore, while volumes have grown by 66% year-on-year to 1,625 MW.Shares of Suzlon Energy are currently trading 3.8% lower after the earnings announcement at ₹48.07.
full_content: Shares of Suzlon Energy Ltd. fell over 4% on Thursday, February 5, after the company reported its December quarter results, which were higher on a year-on-year basis.The company's net profit grew by 14.8% from the same quarter last year to ₹445.2 crore from ₹387 crore earlier.Its Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation and Amortisation  for the quarter increased by 48% to ₹730.5 crore from ₹493 crore during the same quarter last year.EBITDA margin for the quarter increased by 70 basis points to 17.3% from 16.6% last year.Revenue growth for the quarter stood at 42.4% year-on-year. Suzlon Energy reported revenue of ₹4,228.1 crore from ₹2,968 crore in the year-ago period.At the end of the quarter, Suzlon Energy had a record order book of 6.4 GW with the highest-ever quarterly deliveries at 617 MW. Execution of 2.4 GW worth of orders is currently underway.The company had a net cash position of ₹1,556 crore at the end of the December quarter."Our closing order book of 6.4 GW stands higher than the opening orderbook for the quarter, despite the highest-ever deliveries in 30 years. This reflects the demand for our solutions and the effectiveness of our execution," JP Chalasani, CEO Of the Suzlon Group said. "Our project development pipeline of 25+ GW is also complementing this strategy to augur growth for us. The success of this shift is enhancing revenue visibility, improving project control, and will continue to be a big growth driver for the group," he added.For the first nine months of the year, Suzlon Energy's revenue has grown by 58% from the same period last year to ₹11,211 crore, while volumes have grown by 66% year-on-year to 1,625 MW.Shares of Suzlon Energy are currently trading 3.8% lower after the earnings announcement at ₹48.07. The stock is down nearly 50% from its recent peak of ₹84.

headline: 360 ONE Mutual Fund to launch its first SIF on February 6
condensed_text: The new fund offer  will be open from February 6 to February 20, 2026.The DynaSIF Equity Long–Short Fund is an open-ended equity strategy aimed at investors seeking long-term capital appreciation through selective long and short positions in listed equities and equity derivatives. It is the first strategy under DynaSIF, a new investment platform introduced by 360 ONE Mutual Fund under SEBI’s SIF framework.A new SEBI-regulated asset class introduced in 2025, SIFs are designed to provide greater flexibility in portfolio construction while operating within a regulated framework.Quant Mutual Fund, SBI Mutual Fund, and Edelwiess are among active SIF offerings in the market, according to SIF360.SIFFund HouseMinimum InvestmentExit LoadQSIF SeriesQuant Mutual Fund₹10 lakh1% if redeemed on or before 15 days from allotmentMagnum Hybrid Long-Short SIFSBI Mutual Fund₹10 lakh0.50% if redeemed on or before 15 days; 0.25% if redeemed after 15 days but on or before 1 monthAltiva Hybrid Long-Short SIFEdelweiss Mutual Fund₹10 lakh0.50% if redeemed within the specified lock-in periodThe minimum investment amount for the DynaSIF Equity Long–Short Fund is ₹10 lakh, while accredited investors can invest with a minimum of ₹1 lakh. The exit load is set at 0.5% if redeemed within three months from the date of allotment.360 ONE Mutual Fund said it manages assets of around ₹13,479 crore as of December 31, 2025, and offers schemes across equity, hybrid and debt categories.Also Read: SEBI updates SIF reporting rules: What investors should know The fund house claims that DynaSIF platform has been positioned between traditional mutual funds and alternative investment strategies, while retaining transparency, operational ease and governance standards applicable to mutual funds.The fund house claims that DynaSIF platform has been positioned between traditional mutual funds and alternative investment strategies, while retaining transparency, operational ease and governance standards applicable to mutual funds.The fund will maintain a minimum allocation of 80% to equities and equity derivatives, with the flexibility to take limited short exposure of up to 25% through equity derivatives. “The SIF framework allows for greater flexibility, institutional-grade risk management, and outcome-oriented strategies, while retaining the governance and taxation efficiencies of mutual funds,” Maheshwari added.The benchmark for the fund is the BSE 500 TRI, and it falls under Risk Band Level 5.Raghav Iyengar, CEO, 360 ONE Asset Management Ltd, said, “With DynaSIF, we are introducing a new investment platform that blends innovation with prudence in line with SEBI’s SIF framework. As markets evolve, alpha may increasingly come from adaptability, risk awareness, and differentiated thinking, especially in an environment where leadership and cycles are constantly shifting.”Also Read: Union Mutual Fund forays into specialised investment funds with Arthaya SIF launch

The exit load is set at 0.5% if redeemed within three months from the date of allotment.360 ONE Mutual Fund said it manages assets of around ₹13,479 crore as of December 31, 2025, and offers schemes across equity, hybrid and debt categories.Also Read: SEBI updates SIF reporting rules: What investors should know The fund house claims that DynaSIF platform has been positioned between traditional mutual funds and alternative investment strategies, while retaining transparency, operational ease and governance standards applicable to mutual funds.The fund house claims that DynaSIF platform has been positioned between traditional mutual funds and alternative investment strategies, while retaining transparency, operational ease and governance standards applicable to mutual funds.The fund will maintain a minimum allocation of 80% to equities and equity derivatives, with the flexibility to take limited short exposure of up to 25% through equity derivatives. headline: DA Dispute: Supreme Court directs West Bengal govt to clear arrears from 2008-2019
condensed_text: DA Dispute: Supreme Court directs West Bengal govt to clear arrears from 2008-2019. The Supreme Court on Thursday, February 6, granted major relief to nearly 20 lakh West Bengal government employees in the long-pending dearness allowance  dispute, directing the state to clear DA arrears for the period between 2008 and 2019.The court reiterated its earlier interim order, stating that at least 25% of the outstanding arrears must be paid by March 6, while the remaining amount is to be released in a phased manner.The dispute stems from the West Bengal government’s decision to pay DA at rates significantly lower than those applicable to central government employees, despite repeated demands by state employee unions for parity.Several unions had moved the courts, arguing that DA is a component of salary meant to offset inflation and cannot be denied or delayed indefinitely.The matter has been under litigation for years, with the Supreme Court previously noting that prolonged non-payment of DA arrears was unjustified.
full_content: The Supreme Court on Thursday, February 6, granted major relief to nearly 20 lakh West Bengal government employees in the long-pending dearness allowance  dispute, directing the state to clear DA arrears for the period between 2008 and 2019.The court reiterated its earlier interim order, stating that at least 25% of the outstanding arrears must be paid by March 6, while the remaining amount is to be released in a phased manner.The dispute stems from the West Bengal government’s decision to pay DA at rates significantly lower than those applicable to central government employees, despite repeated demands by state employee unions for parity.Several unions had moved the courts, arguing that DA is a component of salary meant to offset inflation and cannot be denied or delayed indefinitely.The matter has been under litigation for years, with the Supreme Court previously noting that prolonged non-payment of DA arrears was unjustified.

headline: Godrej Properties Q3 Results: Bookings at 74% of FY26 guidance; Co confident of meeting projections
condensed_text: Shares of Godrej Properties Ltd. declined on Thursday, February 4, even as the company said it is on track to achieve its booking guidance for the full year. It added that it remains on track to beat its guidance of ₹32,500 crore for the financial year 2026.Godrej Properties reported a net profit of ₹195.2 crore in the December quarter, up 20% from the previous year's ₹162.6 crore.Its revenue declined 48.6% to ₹498.4 crore in the quarter under review from 969 crore in the third quarter of the previous fiscal.It also reported an earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation  loss of ₹182.7 crore compared to an EBTIDA profit of ₹27.7 crore in the year-ago period.Its bookings increased 55% to ₹8,421 crore, while collections were up 40% at 4,282 crore. The company's operating cash flows also increased 73% to ₹1,062 crore.In the first nine months of FY26, Godrej Properties' bookings increased 25% to ₹24,008 crore, collections increased 19% to ₹12,018 crore but its operating cash flow declined 7% at ₹3,199 crore.Godrej Properties said in the third quarter, it added three new projects with an estimated saleable area of 7.3 million square feet. In nine months of this fiscal, the company has added 12 new projects with an estimated saleable area of 22.36 million square feet.The company said sales growth is spread across the markets it is operating in and was on the back of strong volumes and pricing growth. It said it is confident of ending FY26 as its best-ever year across all operating metrics.Shares of Godrej Properties fell as much as 4% after the results announcement, but are looking to recover from the lows of the day, currently trading 1.4% lower at ₹1,687.Also Read: Uno Minda Q3 Results: Stock recovers after improved earnings; ₹764 crore capex announcement

headline: Nava Q3 Results: Revenue up 18% YoY; profit slips on manufacturing costs and tax hit
condensed_text: Nava Q3 Results: Revenue up 18% YoY; profit slips on manufacturing costs and tax hit. Nava Limited reported a mixed performance for Q3FY26, with revenue rising 17.6% year-on-year to ₹991 crore from ₹842.5 crore, driven by steady momentum across key operating segments. However, profitability came under pressure as EBITDA slipped 1.6% to ₹442.8 crore, while margins narrowed sharply to 44.7% from 53.4% a year ago.Net profit declined 11.3% year-on-year to ₹222 crore, weighed down by higher manufacturing expenses and a sharper tax outgo. Manufacturing costs rose to ₹124 crore from ₹118 crore, while tax expenses climbed to ₹57.4 crore compared with ₹41.3 crore last year.Segmentally, ferro alloys revenue surged to ₹266.2 crore from ₹165.9 crore, while the energy segment reported revenues of ₹883 crore versus ₹832 crore. Mining revenues improved to ₹134.6 crore from ₹115.9 crore.For context, the consolidated Q2 FY26 performance had also seen margin pressure, with EBITDA and profit declining despite moderate revenue growth, underscoring persistent cost challenges.Also Read: Suzlon Energy Q3 Results: Revenue growth of 42%, margin expands but stock falls 4%Post earnings, shares of Nava Limited were trading at ₹562.65 on the NSE, down 2.61%, recovering from the day’s low of ₹550.10.
full_content: Nava Limited reported a mixed performance for Q3FY26, with revenue rising 17.6% year-on-year to ₹991 crore from ₹842.5 crore, driven by steady momentum across key operating segments. However, profitability came under pressure as EBITDA slipped 1.6% to ₹442.8 crore, while margins narrowed sharply to 44.7% from 53.4% a year ago.Net profit declined 11.3% year-on-year to ₹222 crore, weighed down by higher manufacturing expenses and a sharper tax outgo. Manufacturing costs rose to ₹124 crore from ₹118 crore, while tax expenses climbed to ₹57.4 crore compared with ₹41.3 crore last year.Segmentally, ferro alloys revenue surged to ₹266.2 crore from ₹165.9 crore, while the energy segment reported revenues of ₹883 crore versus ₹832 crore. Mining revenues improved to ₹134.6 crore from ₹115.9 crore.For context, the consolidated Q2 FY26 performance had also seen margin pressure, with EBITDA and profit declining despite moderate revenue growth, underscoring persistent cost challenges.Also Read: Suzlon Energy Q3 Results: Revenue growth of 42%, margin expands but stock falls 4%Post earnings, shares of Nava Limited were trading at ₹562.65 on the NSE, down 2.61%, recovering from the day’s low of ₹550.10.

headline: Alembic Pharma Q3 Results: Topline up 11%, margins hold; India, US markets post 6% growth
condensed_text: Alembic Pharmaceuticals reported a steady operating performance in Q3, with revenue rising 10.8% year-on-year to ₹1,876.3 crore, supported by consistent execution across domestic and international businesses. EBITDA grew 12.8% to ₹293.5 crore, while margins improved marginally to 15.6% from 15.4% a year ago.Net profit declined 4.1% year-on-year to ₹132 crore, impacted by a one-time provision of ₹42 crore towards employee benefits following changes under the new labour code.Post the earnings announcement, shares of Alembic Pharmaceuticals Ltd were trading 1.79% higher at ₹812.65 on the NSE.India and international businesses deliver growthThe India branded business posted 6% year-on-year growth to ₹652 crore, led by the gynaecology, ophthalmology and animal healthcare segments. The anti-infective portfolio grew broadly in line with market trends, while the company also introduced four new products during the quarter.Internationally, US generics revenue rose 6% to ₹553 crore, with two new product launches during the quarter. Alembic received seven ANDA approvals during the quarter, taking cumulative approvals to 232.Also Read: Nava Q3 Results: Revenue up 18% YoY; profit slips on manufacturing costs and tax hitR&D focus and pipeline expansionThe API business grew 2% year-on-year to ₹264 crore. Managing Director Pranav Amin said the company maintained its operating rhythm, invested around 9% of revenue in R&D, and made progress on integrating Utility Therapeutics, with the launch of Pivya™ expected in Q4 to strengthen its US branded portfolio.
full_content: Alembic Pharmaceuticals reported a steady operating performance in Q3, with revenue rising 10.8% year-on-year to ₹1,876.3 crore, supported by consistent execution across domestic and international businesses. EBITDA grew 12.8% to ₹293.5 crore, while margins improved marginally to 15.6% from 15.4% a year ago.Net profit declined 4.1% year-on-year to ₹132 crore, impacted by a one-time provision of ₹42 crore towards employee benefits following changes under the new labour code.Post the earnings announcement, shares of Alembic Pharmaceuticals Ltd were trading 1.79% higher at ₹812.65 on the NSE.India and international businesses deliver growthThe India branded business posted 6% year-on-year growth to ₹652 crore, led by the gynaecology, ophthalmology and animal healthcare segments. The anti-infective portfolio grew broadly in line with market trends, while the company also introduced four new products during the quarter.Internationally, US generics revenue rose 6% to ₹553 crore, with two new product launches during the quarter. Ex-US international generics saw strong momentum, growing 36% year-on-year to ₹406 crore. Alembic received seven ANDA approvals during the quarter, taking cumulative approvals to 232.Also Read: Nava Q3 Results: Revenue up 18% YoY; profit slips on manufacturing costs and tax hitR&D focus and pipeline expansionThe API business grew 2% year-on-year to ₹264 crore. Managing Director Pranav Amin said the company maintained its operating rhythm, invested around 9% of revenue in R&D, and made progress on integrating Utility Therapeutics, with the launch of Pivya™ expected in Q4 to strengthen its US branded portfolio.

headline: Suzlon Energy Q3 results: Net profit up 15% to  Rs 445 crore; stock falls 5%
condensed_text: Renewable energy major Suzlon Energy on Thursday reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 445.28 crore for the third quarter ended December 31, 2025, a growth of 15.1 per cent compared to Rs 386.92 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal year. The Pune-headquartered company witnessed a surge in its top line, with revenue from operations climbing 42.4 per cent to Rs 4,228.18 crore in Q3 FY26, against Rs 2,968.81 crore recorded in the year-ago period. This growth was fuelled by the company's highest-ever quarterly deliveries of 617 MW, a increase from 447 MW delivered in Q3 FY25, the company noted in its exchange filing. Girish Tanti, Vice Chairman, Suzlon Group, said that the company has initiated Suzlon 2.0, a comprehensive business transformation strategy aimed at establishing itself as a full-stack clean energy solutions conglomerate. JP Chalasani, Chief Executive Officer, Suzlon Group, said "Our closing order book of 6.4 GW stands higher than the opening order book for the quarter, despite the highest-ever deliveries in 30 years."
full_content:
Renewable energy major Suzlon Energy on Thursday reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 445.28 crore for the third quarter ended December 31, 2025, a growth of 15.1 per cent compared to Rs 386.92 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal year.
At 1:43 pm, shares of Suzlon Energy was down 5.18 to Rs 47.20 apiece on BSE.
The Pune-headquartered company witnessed a surge in its top line, with revenue from operations climbing 42.4 per cent to Rs 4,228.18 crore in Q3 FY26, against Rs 2,968.81 crore recorded in the year-ago period. This growth was fuelled by the company's highest-ever quarterly deliveries of 617 MW, a increase from 447 MW delivered in Q3 FY25, the company noted in its exchange filing.
The company’s EBITDA zoomed 48 per cent to Rs 739 crore during the quarter under review, compared to Rs 500 crore in the same quarter last year. The EBITDA margin improved to 17.5 per cent from 16.8 per cent year-on-year. The company also reported a net cash position of Rs 1,556 crore as of December 31, 2025. With a project development pipeline of over 25 GW and execution of 2.4 GW currently underway.
Girish Tanti, Vice Chairman, Suzlon Group, said that the company has initiated Suzlon 2.0, a comprehensive business transformation strategy aimed at establishing itself as a full-stack clean energy solutions conglomerate. He noted that this strategic shift broadens the company's scope across wind, solar, storage, and emerging clean energy technologies.
JP Chalasani, Chief Executive Officer, Suzlon Group, said "Our closing order book of 6.4 GW stands higher than the opening order book for the quarter, despite the highest-ever deliveries in 30 years."

headline: Chennai Petro, M&M Financial, Coforge Ltd & Persistent: Nilesh Jain of Centrum Broking shares view
condensed_text: Nilesh Jain, Assistant Vice-President (Derivative and Technical Research) at Centrum Broking, expects markets to remain rangebound, with the benchmark NSE Nifty50 likely to trade in the 25,600-25,800 zone. If the index breaks above 25,800, then we may get a confirmation of a follow-up move on the upside," he told Business Today on Thursday. In response to a query on Coforge Ltd and Persistent Systems Ltd , he said, "Immediate support for Coforge could be seen at Rs 1,566. The 30-share BSE Sensex pack and the NSE Nifty50 barometer were down 0.59 per cent and 0.61 per cent, respectively, at the last check. The broader market underperformed the frontline indices, with the Nifty Midcap index declining 0.71 per cent and the Nifty Smallcap index tumbling 1.58 per cent.
full_content:
Nilesh Jain, Assistant Vice-President (Derivative and Technical Research) at Centrum Broking, expects markets to remain rangebound, with the benchmark NSE Nifty50 likely to trade in the 25,600-25,800 zone. Any dip towards 25,600 could be seen as a buying opportunity. If the index breaks above 25,800, then we may get a confirmation of a follow-up move on the upside," he told Business Today on Thursday.
On the stock-specific front, Jain noted that Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Ltd looked attractive at current levels. "The counter may climb towards Rs 395-400. Keep a stop loss placed at Rs 368 for this trade," he added.
In response to a query on Coforge Ltd and Persistent Systems Ltd , he said, "Immediate support for Coforge could be seen at Rs 1,566. If the stock falls below that mentioned level, there could be a possibility of another leg on the lower side. Major support is placed at Rs 1,500. If it breaks this level, then it would be considered a structural breakdown. There could be a possibility of some pullback, but the stock is looking that positive at present."
Jain finds Persistent Systems comparatively better placed than Coforge at present. "We may move towards Rs 6,000-6,100. Maintain stop loss at Rs 5,760," he added.
He highlighted that Chennai Petroleum Corporation Ltd has given a fresh breakout. "I believe there has to be a follow-up on the upside towards Rs 930-950. Keep stop loss placed at Rs 885," he stated.
Meanwhile, domestic equity benchmarks snapped their three-session winning streak in Thursday's afternoon trade, slipping sharply amid profit booking and weak global cues.
The 30-share BSE Sensex pack and the NSE Nifty50 barometer were down 0.59 per cent and 0.61 per cent, respectively, at the last check.
The broader market underperformed the frontline indices, with the Nifty Midcap index declining 0.71 per cent and the Nifty Smallcap index tumbling 1.58 per cent.
