headline: Adani Enterprises confirms talks with US sanctions office over Wall Street Journal report
condensed_text: Adani Enterprises has disclosed that it has voluntarily initiated engagement with the US Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) in connection with allegations referenced in a Wall Street Journal article published on June 2, 2025. In a regulatory filing made under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, the company said it began discussions with OFAC proactively and in a cooperative and transparent manner. As part of this engagement, Adani Enterprises, through its legal counsel, received a formal Request for Information (RFI) from OFAC dated February 4, 2026 (India time) and February 3, 2026 (US time). The disclosure follows allegations highlighted in the June 2025 Wall Street Journal report, which had claimed thatGautam Adaniwas seeking intervention from officials in the administration of then US President Donald Trump to have foreign bribery charges dropped. Adani Group had denied the allegations at the time, stating that it had not engaged in sanctions evasion or trade involving Iranian-origin LPG and that it was not aware of any investigation by US authorities on the matter.
full_content:
Adani Enterprises has disclosed that it has voluntarily initiated engagement with the US Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) in connection with allegations referenced in a Wall Street Journal article published on June 2, 2025.
In a regulatory filing made under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, the company said it began discussions with OFAC proactively and in a cooperative and transparent manner. As part of this engagement, Adani Enterprises, through its legal counsel, received a formal Request for Information (RFI) from OFAC dated February 4, 2026 (India time) and February 3, 2026 (US time).
The company said it is in the process of responding to the information request as part of the ongoing dialogue with the US authority. Details of the RFI have been disclosed in the prescribed format attached to the filing.
The disclosure follows allegations highlighted in the June 2025 Wall Street Journal report, which had claimed thatGautam Adaniwas seeking intervention from officials in the administration of then US President Donald Trump to have foreign bribery charges dropped. The report had also stated that US prosecutors were examining whether entities linked to the Adani Group imported liquefied petroleum gas of Iranian origin into India via the group-operated Mundra port.
The report cited an analysis of tanker traffic between the Persian Gulf and Mundra, suggesting patterns that investigators sometimes associate with sanctions evasion.
Adani Group had denied the allegations at the time, stating that it had not engaged in sanctions evasion or trade involving Iranian-origin LPG and that it was not aware of any investigation by US authorities on the matter.

headline: Citi says $90-mn Lupin-Astellas Pharma settlement may delay rival generic launches
condensed_text: Citi Research said Lupin's $90-million patent settlement with Astellas Pharma may prevent other generic drugmakers from launching generic Mirabegron for an extended period, potentially giving Lupin and Zydus Lifesciences about 12–18 months of limited competition. Lupin said on Tuesday it agreed to a $90-million settlement with Japan's Astellas Pharma in a patent dispute over the bladder disorder drug Mirabegron, a move that allows it to continue selling the product in the United States. Under the agreement, Lupin and its US unit will pay Astellas a $75 million upfront payment and per-unit licensing fees on Mirabegron sales through September 2027, the company said in an exchange filing. In a separate statement, the Japanese drugmaker said the settlement concludes its litigation with Lupin and added that it is reviewing the potential financial impact for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2026. Lupin had previously disclosed the patent dispute with Astellas last April over its generic version of Myrbetriq, Astellas' overactive bladder drug, after a U.S. court ruling raised the risk that generic versions could be withdrawn from the market.
full_content:
Citi Research said Lupin's $90-million patent settlement with Astellas Pharma may prevent other generic drugmakers from launching generic Mirabegron for an extended period, potentially giving Lupin and Zydus Lifesciences about 12–18 months of limited competition.
The settlement allows Lupin to continue selling its generic version of Mirabegron, a bladder disorder drug, eliminating legal risks associated with prolonged litigation,s said the global brokerage.
Citi maintained "buy" rating onLupinwith price target of Rs 2,260.
At 12:05 pm on February 10, Lupin shares were trading 1% higher at Rs 2,218.2. So far in 2026, the Lupin stock rose 5%.
Lupin said on Tuesday it agreed to a $90-million settlement with Japan's Astellas Pharma in a patent dispute over the bladder disorder drug Mirabegron, a move that allows it to continue selling the product in the United States.
Under the agreement, Lupin and its US unit will pay Astellas a $75 million upfront payment and per-unit licensing fees on Mirabegron sales through September 2027, the company said in an exchange filing.
In a separate statement, the Japanese drugmaker said the settlement concludes its litigation with Lupin and added that it is reviewing the potential financial impact for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2026.
Lupin had previously disclosed the patent dispute with Astellas last April over its generic version of Myrbetriq, Astellas' overactive bladder drug, after a U.S. court ruling raised the risk that generic versions could be withdrawn from the market.

headline: Destabilised Bangladesh, a near-term risk for Arvind but long-term opportunity for India: Punit Lalbhai
condensed_text:

Arvind Website
A destabilised Bangladesh could hurt Gujarat-based textile manufacturer Arvind Ltd in the short term but also create an opening for India’s apparel ambitions, Vice Chairman Punit Lalbhai said. And I don’t want Bangladesh to suffer,” Lalbhai said, noting that Bangladesh remains a key end market for the company’s fabric business and that Arvind has a “high dependency” on India’s eastern neighbour. “It could be an opportunity on the yarn side because yarn prices will go down, but that’s not good for India because we have a lot of yarn capacity that has come up. “We are having conversations with customers, and we are reallocating a lot of internal marketing and sales resources to focus on these geographies so that we can build the pipeline before the implementation of the duty-free tariff,” Lalbhai said. “If I have $1 to invest, I will invest it in garmenting because garmenting is easier to sell and customers increasingly want a vertical offering rather than just fabric.
full_content:
Punit Lalbhai, Vice Chairman, Arvind Ltd
Arvind Website
A destabilised Bangladesh could hurt Gujarat-based textile manufacturer Arvind Ltd in the short term but also create an opening for India’s apparel ambitions, Vice Chairman Punit Lalbhai said.
“In the short term, disruption in Bangladesh is not good for Arvind. For India, it is a huge opportunity. And I’m a patriot. So, I want India to grow. And I don’t want Bangladesh to suffer,” Lalbhai said, noting that Bangladesh remains a key end market for the company’s fabric business and that Arvind has a “high dependency” on India’s eastern neighbour.
“I think a destabilised Bangladesh is more a risk than an opportunity for us because our garment business is still relatively small compared to our fabric portfolio. Bangladesh is today a key end market for our fabrics. So, if there is disruption in the Bangladesh market for whatever reason, it’s not great news for us. We want a stable Bangladesh,” he told investors recently. He said Arvind’s garment exposure in Bangladesh is smaller than its fabric business, though the company has reduced its dependence over recent years. “Almost all of our export denim used to go to Bangladesh. Now, it is far better distributed. Bangladesh is still important, but there are newer geographies where our denim is going,” he added.
Highlighting the divergence between company-level risk and national opportunity, Lalbhai said a Bangladesh slowdown could also soften yarn prices, creating mixed outcomes for the industry. “It could be an opportunity on the yarn side because yarn prices will go down, but that’s not good for India because we have a lot of yarn capacity that has come up. So sometimes what is good for the whole industry and what is good for an individual player is not the same thing,” he said.
Over the longer term, India needs to expand garmenting capacity to emerge as a global manufacturing force, Lalbhai said. “In the long term, it is good for everybody that India develops its own garmenting capacity. We have to take market share from all our neighbours. We have been punching below our weight as an industry in garments, and we have to grow aggressively,” he said.
The implementation of free trade agreements with the UK and the European Union could accelerate this shift, he added. “With the EU, it is a really big deal for our industry. All our competition has had duty-free access to these geographies. Now, suddenly, we will be on a level playing field with them,” Lalbhai said.
“All countries, all customers are worried about overdependence on Bangladesh,” he said. “India suddenly starts looking much more attractive.” Arvind has already begun reallocating internal resources to capture these opportunities. “We are having conversations with customers, and we are reallocating a lot of internal marketing and sales resources to focus on these geographies so that we can build the pipeline before the implementation of the duty-free tariff,” Lalbhai said.
Duty-free access to the UK and EU would also help rebalance Arvind’s geographic exposure. “That will go a long way in de-risking some of our US dependency,” he said.
On capital allocation, Lalbhai said garmenting remains the priority. “If I have $1 to invest, I will invest it in garmenting because garmenting is easier to sell and customers increasingly want a vertical offering rather than just fabric. Nobody buys fabric in the EU and the UK — they only buy full-package garments,” he said.
Published on  February 10, 2026
BACK TO TOP

headline: Tata Steel shares rise 7% in two days after strong Q3. Should investors buy now?
condensed_text: Shares of one of India’s leading steel manufacturers, Tata Steel , rose as much as 4.5% to their day’s high of Rs 911 on the BSE on Tuesday, extending gains for a second session in a row following the company’s third quarter earnings. In India, spreads are likely to expand as a Rs 3,500 per tonne recovery in HRC spot prices could lift blended NSRs by around Rs 2,300 per tonne QoQ, factoring in product mix and contracts. Consolidated volumes are projected to rise 10% YoY to around 9.2 MT in Q4FY26F, leading to an estimated sequential increase of about Rs 400 per tonne in consolidated EBITDA to roughly Rs 10,400 per tonne. Elara Capital has reiterated its Accumulate rating on Tata Steel and raised its target price to Rs 215 from Rs 187, citing the recent uptick in steel prices since mid-December and the imposition of safeguard duties on imports, which are expected to support near-term earnings growth. Elara noted that the anticipated reduction in funding overhang from domestic operations toward EU businesses has led it to revise the valuation multiple for domestic operations to 6.5x EV/EBITDA from 6.0x earlier, while retaining a 5.0x multiple for other businesses.
full_content: Shares of one of India’s leading steel manufacturers, Tata Steel , rose as much as 4.5% to their day’s high of Rs 911 on the BSE on Tuesday, extending gains for a second session in a row following the company’s third quarter earnings. The stock is up over 7% during the same period. Consolidated net profit attributable to owners of the company jumped 723% YoY to Rs 2,689 crore from Rs 327 crore a year ago. Revenue from operations rose 6% YoY to Rs 57,002 crore in Q3FY26 compared with Rs 53,648 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. On a sequential basis, however, profit after tax declined 13% from Rs 3,102 crore in Q2FY26, while revenue fell 3% from Rs 58,689 crore in the July–September quarter. EBITDA stood at Rs 8,309 crore, up 39% YoY, with margins around 15%. In India, revenue came in at Rs 35,725 crore and EBITDA at Rs 8,291 crore, translating into a margin of 23%. Crude steel production in India increased 12% YoY to 6.34 million tons, while deliveries rose 14% YoY to a record 6.04 million tons — the company’s highest-ever quarterly deliveries. Should you buy, sell or hold? Live Events Axis Securities has maintained a Buy call and a target price of Rs 220 and expects an improvement in spreads during Q4FY26. In India, spreads are likely to expand as a Rs 3,500 per tonne recovery in HRC spot prices could lift blended NSRs by around Rs 2,300 per tonne QoQ, factoring in product mix and contracts. Although coking coal costs are projected to rise by about $15 per tonne, the impact is expected to be largely offset by sequential volume growth and a better product mix, supporting an EBITDA recovery in Q4FY26. Nomura has maintained a Buy rating on Tata Steel and set a target price of Rs 220, citing expectations of margin expansion in Q4FY26 driven by stronger HRC pricing. The brokerage expects domestic blended realisations per tonne to improve by about 4% QoQ, or roughly Rs 2,300 per tonne. On the cost front, rising coking coal prices are likely to weigh on domestic operations, with management guiding for a $15 per tonne increase. Consolidated volumes are projected to rise 10% YoY to around 9.2 MT in Q4FY26F, leading to an estimated sequential increase of about Rs 400 per tonne in consolidated EBITDA to roughly Rs 10,400 per tonne. The brokerage noted that Tata Steel has delivered resilient performance even when HRC prices were near cyclical lows. While FY27F and FY28F consolidated volume forecasts remain unchanged, EBITDA estimates have been increased by 4% on improved pricing assumptions. Nomura’s EBITDA per tonne projections for FY27F and FY28F are 5% and 3% above consensus, respectively. The target price is based on a one-year forward EV/EBITDA multiple of 7.0x, unchanged, while the stock currently trades at around 8.1x. Elara Capital has reiterated its Accumulate rating on Tata Steel and raised its target price to Rs 215 from Rs 187, citing the recent uptick in steel prices since mid-December and the imposition of safeguard duties on imports, which are expected to support near-term earnings growth. The brokerage has increased its EBITDA estimates for FY26 by 2% while maintaining projections for FY27 and FY28E. Elara noted that the anticipated reduction in funding overhang from domestic operations toward EU businesses has led it to revise the valuation multiple for domestic operations to 6.5x EV/EBITDA from 6.0x earlier, while retaining a 5.0x multiple for other businesses. It has also rolled forward its valuation base to December 2027E from September 2027E, resulting in the (Disclaimer: The recommendations, suggestions, views, and opinions given by the experts are their own. headline: US OFAC probing past transactions possibly linked to Iran: Adani Enterprises
condensed_text: Adani Enterprises Ltd on Tuesday said the United States Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) is conducting a civil investigation into certain of the company’s past transactions processed through US financial institutions, which may have involved --- directly or indirectly --- Iran or entities subject to US sanctions. In a regulatory filing, the company said it received a Request for Information (RFI) from OFAC through its legal counsel on February 4 (India time). “In the RFI, OFAC has also indicated that it is conducting a civil investigation of the Company’s transactions processed through U.S. financial institutions that may have involved, directly or indirectly, Iran or interests of persons subject to U.S. sanctions against Iran,” the company stated in its filing. It also stated that Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) --- which seems to be the subject of the inquiry ---constituted a non-material portion of revenues, accounting for 1.46 percent of Adani Enterprises’ revenue and 0.5 percent of the Adani Group’s overall revenue in FY25. “As a matter of abundant caution and in furtherance of its cooperation efforts, the Company has ceased all LPG imports with effect from June 2, 2025,” the filing said.
full_content:
Adani Enterprises Ltd on Tuesday said the United States Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) is conducting a civil investigation into certain of the company’s past transactions processed through US financial institutions, which may have involved --- directly or indirectly --- Iran or entities subject to US sanctions.
In a regulatory filing, the company said it received a Request for Information (RFI) from OFAC through its legal counsel on February 4 (India time). The RFI forms part of the ongoing civil inquiry, the company said. “In the RFI, OFAC has also indicated that it is conducting a civil investigation of the Company’s transactions processed through U.S. financial institutions that may have involved, directly or indirectly, Iran or interests of persons subject to U.S. sanctions against Iran,” the company stated in its filing.
Adani Enterprises said it is cooperating fully with the U.S. regulator and will respond within the prescribed timelines. “The Company is currently reviewing the RFI and is unable to assess the potential outcome of the matter at this stage,” it added.
The company also said it expects no material financial impact from the investigation. It also stated that Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) --- which seems to be the subject of the inquiry ---constituted a non-material portion of revenues, accounting for 1.46 percent of Adani Enterprises’ revenue and 0.5 percent of the Adani Group’s overall revenue in FY25. “As a matter of abundant caution and in furtherance of its cooperation efforts, the Company has ceased all LPG imports with effect from June 2, 2025,” the filing said.
The company added that it had voluntarily initiated engagement with OFAC, and would make further disclosures as required under applicable regulations. The engagement followed allegations reported by The Wall Street Journal in June 2025.
Published on  February 10, 2026

The turnaround time for greenfield units in new clusters has been impressive and thereby demonstrates strong execution. New leadership team hiring across Karnataka and Kerala provides comfort for faster ramp-up in these clusters. Given its lean cost structure and partnership with local doctors/ leadership outside Andhra Pradesh (AP) and Telangana, we remain confident of achieving faster breakeven and +25% OPM across Maharashtra, Karnataka and Kerala clusters over the next 3-4 years.
Outlook
Our FY27E and FY28E EBITDA broadly remain unchanged. We expect 31% EBITDA CAGR over FY26-28E. Maintain ‘Buy’ rating with TP of Rs 810/share based on 27x FY28E EV/EBITDA.

headline: Tracxn Tech hits 20% upper circuit after Mukul Agrawal purchases 20 lakh shares for Rs 6.6 crore
condensed_text: Tracxn Technologies share price hit the 20 percent upper circuit in early trade on Tuesday a day after ace investor Mukul Mahavir Agrawal bought 20 lakh shares of the company for Rs 6.6 crore through a bulk deal. The stock opened with a gap-up gain of 6.46 percent and advanced to an intraday high of Rs 40.68 per share on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a 20 percent jump, which is also its upper circuit limit. The sharp rise came after Agrawal purchased 20,00,000 shares at Rs 33 per share on Monday, amounting to a total investment of Rs 6.6 crore, as per bulk deal data. According to BSE shareholding data, Agrawal held 20 lakh shares, or a 1.88 percent stake, in the company as of December 31, 2025. Bengaluru-based Tracxn Technologies operates on a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) model and provides market intelligence on private companies.
full_content:
Tracxn Technologies share price hit the 20 percent upper circuit in early trade on Tuesday a day after ace investor Mukul Mahavir Agrawal bought 20 lakh shares of the company for Rs 6.6 crore through a bulk deal.
The stock opened with a gap-up gain of 6.46 percent and advanced to an intraday high of Rs 40.68 per share on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a 20 percent jump, which is also its upper circuit limit.
The stock has been on an upward trajectory for the past two trading sessions.
At around 12:30 pm, the shares pared some gains and were trading at Rs 37.50 per share, still up 10.62 percent.
The sharp rise came after Agrawal purchased 20,00,000 shares at Rs 33 per share on Monday, amounting to a total investment of Rs 6.6 crore, as per bulk deal data.
According to BSE shareholding data, Agrawal held 20 lakh shares, or a 1.88 percent stake, in the company as of December 31, 2025.
Bengaluru-based Tracxn Technologies operates on a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) model and provides market intelligence on private companies.
The company was founded in 2015 by Neha Singh and Abhishek Goyal, both former venture capitalists with Sequoia Capital and Accel Partners, respectively. Tracxn made its stock market debut in 2022 following its initial public offering.
Agrawal also bought shares of Laxmi India Finance at Rs 92.55 per share. As of December 31, 2025, he held 20 lakh shares in the company, representing a 3.83 per cent equity stake.

headline: Tata Motors-Stellantis sign MoU for future collaboration as JV turns 20
condensed_text: Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles and global automotive major Stellantis on February 10, signed a memorandum of understanding to explore new opportunities for collaboration across manufacturing, engineering and supply chain operations, both in India and overseas. In a joint release, Grégoire Olivier, Chief Operating Officer of Stellantis Asia Pacific, said the joint venture exemplifies the value of long-term partnerships. As we commemorate this milestone, we remain focused on evolving the partnership to support future-ready manufacturing, innovation, and sustainable growth in the region,” he said. “Our partnership with Stellantis through FIAPL reflects the strength of a long-standing collaboration built on trust, shared values and a common vision. Industry observers see the renewed collaboration as timely, as automakers increasingly seek strategic alliances to strengthen supply chains, accelerate innovation and enhance competitiveness in a rapidly changing global automotive landscape.
full_content:
Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles and global automotive major Stellantis on February 10, signed a memorandum of understanding to explore new opportunities for collaboration across manufacturing, engineering and supply chain operations, both in India and overseas.
The two companies on Tuesday commemorated 20 years of their successful partnership through Fiat India Automobiles (FIAPL), a 50:50 joint venture. Both share a common manufacturing plant located at Ranjangaon near Pune.
Over the past two decades, FIAPL has built strong capabilities in manufacturing excellence, powertrain development and supply-chain management.
In a joint release, Grégoire Olivier, Chief Operating Officer of Stellantis Asia Pacific, said the joint venture exemplifies the value of long-term partnerships.
“FIAPL stands as a testament to what two strong organizations can achieve together. As we commemorate this milestone, we remain focused on evolving the partnership to support future-ready manufacturing, innovation, and sustainable growth in the region,” he said.
Shailesh Chandra, Managing Director and CEO of Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles, echoed the sentiment, highlighting the trust and shared vision that underpin the alliance.
“Our partnership with Stellantis through FIAPL reflects the strength of a long-standing collaboration built on trust, shared values and a common vision. We look forward to deepening this relationship with Stellantis in the years ahead,” he said.
Industry observers see the renewed collaboration as timely, as automakers increasingly seek strategic alliances to strengthen supply chains, accelerate innovation and enhance competitiveness in a rapidly changing global automotive landscape.

headline: Delivery tech stocks surge: Eternal shares rise 6% to 12-week high, Swiggy up 5%; here’s why
condensed_text:
Eternalshares jumped more than 6 percent to trade at Rs 307.45 apiece on Tuesday, the highest level seen by the stock since November 21. Eternal’s new AI tool:
Zomato on Monday said it has launched a dedicated AI-powered hotline (89200 89200) to simplify the onboarding process for delivery partners, Business Standard reported. According to a company statement quoted by the site, “the call initiates an AI-enabled WhatsApp journey where onboarding and background verification unfold in minutes”. Domestic MFs hike holdings in new age companies, says report:
Additionally, a report by Economic Times claimed that domestic mutual funds held shares worth around Rs 1.77 lakh crore in around 12 new-age companies at the end of 2025. Eternal, which is part of the benchmark Nifty 50 index, accounted for more than 40 percent of total mutual fund holdings in new-age companies, the report said, adding that these funds were major buyers in Swiggy’s Ra 10,000-crore share sale in December last year.
full_content:
The shares of Zomato-parent Eternal and Swiggy surged in trade, rising to multi-week highs on February 10. Multiple factors led to the uptrend in the food delivery and quick commerce stocks today.
Eternalshares jumped more than 6 percent to trade at Rs 307.45 apiece on Tuesday, the highest level seen by the stock since November 21.
Swiggyshares meanwhile surged more than 5 percent to trade at Rs 350.95 apiece, the highest level in nearly a month.
Eternal’s new AI tool:
Zomato on Monday said it has launched a dedicated AI-powered hotline (89200 89200) to simplify the onboarding process for delivery partners, Business Standard reported. According to a company statement quoted by the site, “the call initiates an AI-enabled WhatsApp journey where onboarding and background verification unfold in minutes”.
This comes a year after the company launched an artificial intelligence (AI)-powered customer support platform for businesses across the globe. “Introducing Nugget – an AI-native, no-code customer support platform. Nugget helps scale support effortlessly – highly customizable, low-cost, no developer team needed. No rigid workflows, just seamless automation,” Goyal said in a post on social media platform X (formerly Twitter).
Domestic MFs hike holdings in new age companies, says report:
Additionally, a report by Economic Times claimed that domestic mutual funds held shares worth around Rs 1.77 lakh crore in around 12 new-age companies at the end of 2025. This is around double of the Rs 95,000 crore shares held in the same time last year, the report added.
According to the publication, Eternal and Swiggy are among the key names in which these mutual fund houses accumulated significant stakes.
Eternal, which is part of the benchmark Nifty 50 index, accounted for more than 40 percent of total mutual fund holdings in new-age companies, the report said, adding that these funds were major buyers in Swiggy’s Ra 10,000-crore share sale in December last year.
Block deals:
Eternal and Swiggy shares also saw several block deals being executed on the markets today, further pushing their shares higher up.
Nearly 1.19 crore shares of Eternal changed hands in multiple block deals, according to official market data. At the previous closing price of Rs 288.85 apiece, these shares would be cumulatively worth more than Rs 344 crore.
Swiggy meanwhile saw more than 21.60 lakh shares changing hands in six large block deals. At the previous closing price of Rs 333.70 apiece, these shares would be cumulatively worth around Rs 72.08 crore.
Follow allLIVE updatesfrom the stock markets here.

headline: I-PAC raids: SC adjourns to Feb 18 ED's plea against 'interference' by Mamata Banerjee
condensed_text: I-PAC raids: SC adjourns to Feb 18 ED's plea against 'interference' by Mamata Banerjee. The Supreme Court on Tuesday adjourned to February 18 the hearing on a plea moved by the ED alleging obstruction by the West Bengal government, including by Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, in its search operation at the I-PAC office and the premises of its director in connection with an alleged coal pilferage scam.A bench of Justices Prashant Kumar Mishra and Sandeep Mehta deferred the matter after it was informed that senior advocate Kapil Sibal was unwell.Solicitor General Tushar Mehta agreed to the adjournment.The top court on January 15 said the West Bengal chief minister’s alleged "obstruction" in ED’s probe is "very serious" and agreed to examine if a state’s law-enforcing agencies can interfere with any central agency’s probe into any serious offence as it stayed FIRs against the agency’s officials who raided political consultancy I-PAC on January 8.The top court, while staying the FIRs filed in West Bengal against ED officials, also directed the state police to protect the CCTV footage of the raids.It had issued notices to Banerjee, the West Bengal government, DGP Rajeev Kumar and top cops on the ED’s petitions seeking a CBI probe against them for allegedly obstructing raids at I-PAC premises.The ED has also alleged that Banerjee entered the raid sites and took away ”key” evidence, including physical documents and electronic devices, from the premises of I-PAC and obstructed and interfered with the investigation in the case.The ED has further claimed in its plea that the chief minister’s presence at the search site and the alleged removal of documents had an intimidating effect on officers and seriously compromised the federal probe agency’s ability to discharge its statutory functions independently.The ED’s plea in the apex court follows events from January 8, when the agency conducted searches on the premises of I-PAC and its director Pratik Jain in Kolkata as part of a money-laundering probe into the alleged multi-crore-rupee coal-pilferage scam.During the search operation, Banerjee reached the I-PAC office along with senior TMC leaders, confronted the ED officials and allegedly took away documents from the premises. The chief minister has accused the central agency of overreach.The West Bengal Police has also registered an FIR against ED officers.The TMC has denied the ED’s allegation of obstruction.It has further alleged that the ED action against I-PAC, the election consultant of the party, was aimed at accessing confidential election-strategy material.The party has maintained that I-PAC functions as its election strategist and that the ED’s action was intended to disrupt its electoral preparations rather than pursuing any bona fide investigation in the case.Assembly polls are due in West Bengal in a few months.

Banerjee, in its search operation at the I-PAC office and the premises of its director in connection with an alleged coal pilferage scam.A bench of Justices Prashant Kumar Mishra and Sandeep Mehta deferred the matter after it was informed that senior advocate Kapil Sibal was unwell.Solicitor General Tushar Mehta agreed to the adjournment.The top court on January 15 said the West Bengal chief minister’s alleged "obstruction" in ED’s probe is "very serious" and agreed to examine if a state’s law-enforcing agencies can interfere with any central agency’s probe into any serious offence as it stayed FIRs against the agency’s officials who raided political consultancy I-PAC on January 8.The top court, while staying the FIRs filed in West Bengal against ED officials, also directed the state police to protect the CCTV footage of the raids.It had issued notices to Banerjee, the West Bengal government, DGP Rajeev Kumar and top cops on the ED’s petitions seeking a CBI probe against them for allegedly obstructing raids at I-PAC premises.The ED has also alleged that Banerjee entered the raid sites and took away ”key” evidence, including physical documents and electronic devices, from the premises of I-PAC and obstructed and interfered with the investigation in the case.The ED has further claimed in its plea that the chief minister’s presence at the search site and the alleged removal of documents had an intimidating effect on officers and seriously compromised the federal probe agency’s ability to discharge its statutory functions independently.The ED’s plea in the apex court follows events from January 8, when the agency conducted searches on the premises of I-PAC and its director Pratik Jain in Kolkata as part of a money-laundering probe into the alleged multi-crore-rupee coal-pilferage scam.During the search operation, Banerjee reached the I-PAC office along with senior TMC leaders, confronted the ED officials and allegedly took away documents from the premises. The chief minister has accused the central agency of overreach.The West Bengal Police has also registered an FIR against ED officers.The TMC has denied the ED’s allegation of obstruction.It has further alleged that the ED action against I-PAC, the election consultant of the party, was aimed at accessing confidential election-strategy material.The party has maintained that I-PAC functions as its election strategist and that the ED’s action was intended to disrupt its electoral preparations rather than pursuing any bona fide investigation in the case.Assembly polls are due in West Bengal in a few months.

headline: Edelweiss Financial Services shares gain 7% post positive Q3 results, revenue rises to ₹4,404 crore
condensed_text: Edelweiss Financial Services shares gain 7% post positive Q3 results, revenue rises to ₹4,404 crore. Shares of Edelweiss Financial Services Ltd. surged over 3% after it reported its third quarter earnings on Tuesday, February 10.The company's net profit increased to 264 crore from ₹124.3 crore in the previous year.Its revenue surged to ₹4,404.4 crore from ₹1,898 crore in the year-ago period.Edelweiss said its alternative asset management witnessed a 33% increase fee-paying assets under management  at ₹41,920 crore.Its mutual fund business equity AUM surged 33% as well to ₹83,000 crore and its SIP book crossed the ₹500 crore-mark after increasing 55% from the previous year.It disbursed MSME loans of ₹298 crore in the third quarter, up 5.7 times from the previous year, while its wholesale book reduced 34% to ₹2,400 crore.The company's disbursements in housing finance increased 36% to ₹559 crore, while its AUM increased 21% to ₹4,804 crore.The gross written premium for general insurance increased 47% to ₹404 crore in the December quarter. Edelweiss said it achieved record quarterly policy issuance of 2.54 lakh.In life insurance, the gross premium increased by 15% to ₹514 crore from the previous year and AUM grew by 17% to ₹10,486 crore."We have filed Edelweiss Alternative Asset Advisors'  DRHP for IPO in January and are on track for the listing, marking the first step towards building EAAA as a standalone institutionalised platform," Rashesh Shah, the chairman of Edelweiss Financial Services, said.Shares of Edelweiss Financial Services Ltd. were up 7.2% at ₹119.2 apiece around 1.25 pm on Tuesday. The stock has gained 13.3% in the past month and 27% in the last six months.Also Read: Sterlite Tech shares extend gains, hit fresh 52-week high; Stock surges 70% in a month

headline: Small-cap rally durable with more upside on fundamentals, liquidity: Bajaj Finserv AMC
condensed_text: The recent rebound in small-cap stocks is durable and has much more upside, supported by fundamentals and fresh liquidity, says Nimesh Chandan, Chief Investment Officer at Bajaj Finserv AMC.Explaining why he believes the recovery is sustainable after the recent bounce, Chandan said, “I think it is durable because it is backed by fundamentals. It was the sentiment, which was under pressure, and with the recent news of trade deals, that sentiment has recovered, and with the kind of deal that we've got with the US, I think there's more to come. So, there is much more to come.”Putting recent earnings performance into perspective, Chandan highlighted the sharp outperformance of small caps but cautioned on sustainability, saying, “This quarter, the small caps have delivered much better earnings growth… So large caps have so far given about 12% kind of profit growth. However, you should also look at the basis of how they were last year.”Outlining why the broader business environment in India is improving, he said, “Overall, we are in a better position compared to the last 12 months, because we are seeing the pickup on the consumption side. The cost of capital has come down over the last 12 months, and that is also helping businesses… if your cost of capital is coming down, your domestic market is picking up, and you have prospects in the export market, I think there isa  lot to play with.”Also Read: Global markets are fragile; be cautious with fresh investments, warns Richard HarrisOn whether the sharp earnings growth in small caps can continue, Chandan said sentiment is improving, but growth will normalise, adding, “The sentiment is getting better… from whatever interactions we've had with companies, sentiment is getting better… I don't think this 30% kind of growth can continue, but there is a lot to play within this small cap space now, where quality businesses are seeing some revival in growth and valuations are attractive because the entire category went through a correction in the last few months.”Explaining where his fund is finding opportunities, Chandan said, “We've seen selectively now within different pockets… materials, we are seeing good amount of action in cement, metals and even some of the chemicals companies… within consumer discretionary, now, we are seeing an improvement in demand… within industrial… capital goods, even within power, we are seeing many companies giving good numbers… except for maybe the IT sector, which is again, a top down kind of a negative view that we have.”Detailing how he is positioned for the economic upcycle, he said, “If you see in our portfolio, what we have done is we have added cement across the space… whether it is large cap… and then there are a couple of good mid cap companies… and a couple of small caps there… Metals, again, for ferrous and nonferrous, there are clear leaders in the space, and we go with the largest companies in this area… We have added more weightage among BFSI to private banks… So these three sectors, if you see industrials, materials and financials, these are the sectors you play with the up move or the economic upcycle.”Also Read: HDFC Life, SBI Life and Max Financial now on similar footing, Bernstein cautious on PB FintechOn the information technology sector, Chandan said weak sentiment is likely to persist, even though a sharp fall is unlikely, stating, “If sentimental negative will carry for some time… every few months probably you will see… because every company is working towards productivity gains… I think this hangover will continue for some time, and it will weigh on the valuations… But the cash flows, the return on capital ratios, the dividend payments or even buybacks… may not lead to a severe fall in the IT sector.

And this time, we are seeing some liquidity support come into these areas. So, as I've been saying, we are seeing a positive move in the economic cycle, a positive move in the profit cycle, or the business cycle, and a positive move in the credit cycle. They may be confined to a trading range. headline: Stellantis, Tata Motors sign MoU to deepen collaboration as JV marks 20 years
condensed_text:
REUTERS/Gonzalo Fuentes/File Photo
GONZALO FUENTES
Global auto major Stellantis and Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles on Monday signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to explore deeper collaboration across manufacturing, engineering and supply chains, marking 20 years of their joint venture in India. The partnership, operated through Fiat India Automobiles Private Limited (FIAPL), has produced more than 1.37 million vehicles since its inception and currently manufactures around 2,22,000 vehicles annually. Under the MoU, the two companies will evaluate opportunities for collaboration both in India and overseas, leveraging Stellantis’ global manufacturing and technology expertise and Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles’ local market capabilities. “FIAPL stands as a testament to what two strong organisations can achieve together,” said Grégoire Olivier, Chief Operating Officer, Stellantis Asia Pacific, adding that the focus going forward would be on future-ready manufacturing, innovation and sustainable growth in the region. Shailesh Chandra, Managing Director and CEO of Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles, said the partnership was built on trust and shared values, and that the company looked forward to deepening ties with Stellantis in the years ahead.
full_content:
FILE PHOTO: The logo of Stellantis is seen on a company's building in Velizy-Villacoublay near Paris, France, February 23, 2022. REUTERS/Gonzalo Fuentes/File Photo
GONZALO FUENTES
Global auto major Stellantis and Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles on Monday signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to explore deeper collaboration across manufacturing, engineering and supply chains, marking 20 years of their joint venture in India.
The partnership, operated through Fiat India Automobiles Private Limited (FIAPL), has produced more than 1.37 million vehicles since its inception and currently manufactures around 2,22,000 vehicles annually. The 50:50 joint venture employs close to 5,000 people and operates an integrated vehicle and powertrain facility at Ranjangaon near Pune.
Under the MoU, the two companies will evaluate opportunities for collaboration both in India and overseas, leveraging Stellantis’ global manufacturing and technology expertise and Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles’ local market capabilities.
Currently, FIAPL produces four Jeep models—including the Compass and Meridian—and three Tata Motors passenger vehicles, including the Nexon and Altroz. The facility also exports vehicles to markets such as Japan and South Africa.
“FIAPL stands as a testament to what two strong organisations can achieve together,” said Grégoire Olivier, Chief Operating Officer, Stellantis Asia Pacific, adding that the focus going forward would be on future-ready manufacturing, innovation and sustainable growth in the region.
Shailesh Chandra, Managing Director and CEO of Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles, said the partnership was built on trust and shared values, and that the company looked forward to deepening ties with Stellantis in the years ahead.
The announcement comes at a time when global automakers are reassessing manufacturing footprints and supply chains, with India emerging as a key hub for both domestic sales and exports.
Published on  February 10, 2026
BACK TO TOP

headline: Billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla raises Vodafone Idea stake after purchasing 4 crore shares from open market
condensed_text: Billionaire industrialist and Vodafone Idea promoter Kumar Mangalam Birla has raised his stake in the telecom operator through open market transactions over the past week, acquiring a total of 4.09 crore shares between January 30 and February 1. Of the total, around 2.21 crore shares were bought on January 30 at an average price of Rs 10.95 (discount of 5.5% from the last close) per share, while an additional 1.88 crore shares were purchased on February 1 at an average price of Rs 11.13 (3.8% discount) apiece. As of December 2025, Birla held approximately 1.94 crore shares in Vodafone Idea, representing a 0.02% stake, while the promoter group collectively owned 25.5% of the telecom company. Vodafone Idea Q3 snapshot The telecom operator reported a net loss of Rs 5,286 crore for Q3, narrowing from a loss of Rs 5,524 crore in the previous quarter. Annual payments of Rs 124 crore are scheduled between FY26 and FY31, followed by Rs 100 crore annually from FY32 to FY35, with the remaining balance to be paid in six equal installments between FY36 and FY41.
full_content: Billionaire industrialist and Vodafone Idea promoter Kumar Mangalam Birla has raised his stake in the telecom operator through open market transactions over the past week, acquiring a total of 4.09 crore shares between January 30 and February 1. Of the total, around 2.21 crore shares were bought on January 30 at an average price of Rs 10.95 (discount of 5.5% from the last close) per share, while an additional 1.88 crore shares were purchased on February 1 at an average price of Rs 11.13 (3.8% discount) apiece. The combined transactions represent roughly 0.03% of the company’s outstanding equity. As of December 2025, Birla held approximately 1.94 crore shares in Vodafone Idea, representing a 0.02% stake, while the promoter group collectively owned 25.5% of the telecom company. The latest purchases come after the stock cooled from recent highs, with market participants closely watching whether the move signals renewed confidence from the promoter. Vodafone Idea Q3 snapshot The telecom operator reported a net loss of Rs 5,286 crore for Q3, narrowing from a loss of Rs 5,524 crore in the previous quarter. Revenue rose 1.1% QoQ to Rs 11,323 crore, while EBITDA increased 2.8% to Rs 4,817 crore. EBITDA margin expanded to 42.5% from 41.8% in Q2. Live Events ARPU improved to Rs 186 in Q3FY26 from Rs 173 a year ago, registering a 7.3% YoY increase, mainly driven by customer upgrades. The total subscriber base stood at 19.29 crore, including 12.85 crore 4G and 5G users, up from 12.6 crore in the corresponding period last year. As of December 31, 2025, bank debt was at Rs 1,126 crore. During the quarter, the company raised Rs 3,300 crore through non-convertible debentures (NCDs), while cash and bank balances were at Rs 6,963 crore. Vodafone Idea said the NCD issuance was completed ahead of clarity on the AGR matter, reflecting lender confidence in its turnaround plans. The company added that its AGR liability has been frozen at Rs 87,695 crore as of December 31, 2025, subject to reassessment. Annual payments of Rs 124 crore are scheduled between FY26 and FY31, followed by Rs 100 crore annually from FY32 to FY35, with the remaining balance to be paid in six equal installments between FY36 and FY41. The reassessment process for the AGR liability is currently underway. At about 12:245 pm, Vodafone Idea shares were trading at Rs 11.49. Lower by 0.8% from the last close on the BSE. headline: Chalet Hotels sees strong 2-3 year growth run as demand-supply gap lifts earnings
condensed_text: Chalet Hotels, part of the K Raheja Corp group, expects the hospitality sector to stay on a firm footing over the next couple of years, helped by strong travel demand and a persistent demand-supply gap.Shwetank Singh, MD & CEO of Chalet Hotels highlighted that although January was relatively muted, demand picked up meaningfully in February and has stayed steady into March, keeping the company confident about a solid close to the financial year.Singh expects the next two to three years to remain favourable for the hospitality industry, with revenue per available room growth likely to stay in double digits, led more by rising average room rates than occupancy gains.Chalet Hotels is strengthening its portfolio through the Athiva brand, while maintaining balance-sheet comfort with stable debt levels and adequate headroom to fund future expansions and acquisitions.In October-December quarter , Chalet Hotels reported revenues of ₹581, profit after tax of ₹124 crore and margins of 45.6%.These are edited excerpts of the interview.Q: What does your target stand at in terms of revenue, and what is the expectation now that we should have for FY27?A: Unfortunately, it's hard for me to give you forward numbers, but it has been an excellent growth for us. If I look at quarter three numbers at a consolidated level, we grew revenue by about 27%, with EBITDA growing by 29% but ex-residential, which is a one-off we normally see our business ex-residential, and that's also grown 23% on revenue and 24% on EBITDA, quarter-on-quarter.The other good thing is, on a nine-month consolidated basis, we have grown 24% on revenue to about ₹15,103 odd crores, and about ₹677, crores at EBITDA level, for 28% year-on-year growth. Would that be a fair estimate?A: It's interesting you say that because that if you see pan India numbers for the calendar year, and not talking financial year, because most operators report calendar year numbers, we have come in at about 67% occupancy so far pan India at about ₹8,800 average daily rate , and that brings the revenue per available room  to say ₹5,500 and that growth has been quite steady and very encouraging. Some of the stuff that came through this time is also very heartening, because the approach of the government, clearly, is to improve the overall tourism infrastructure, and not just focus on one part of tourism, and that's one of the things that has been lacking in the country.The experience of tourists who have to be seen holistically and not just one segment of their holiday, so it's great that the government is looking at it that way. So, as a company, we have not moved away from third party operations, Athiva is one of the offerings, and yes, we will favour it, but we will continue to assess it in a dispassionate manner.Finally, just to finish up on debt, our debt remains at about ₹2,000 odd crores that has not moved dramatically from the last time we spoke, and we are very comfortable, sort of placed, both from an internal accrual perspective and headroom to take more debt to sort of fund all our future expansions and acquisitions as they come.Live stock market updates—follow our blog
full_content: Chalet Hotels, part of the K Raheja Corp group, expects the hospitality sector to stay on a firm footing over the next couple of years, helped by strong travel demand and a persistent demand-supply gap.Shwetank Singh, MD & CEO of Chalet Hotels highlighted that although January was relatively muted, demand picked up meaningfully in February and has stayed steady into March, keeping the company confident about a solid close to the financial year.Singh expects the next two to three years to remain favourable for the hospitality industry, with revenue per available room growth likely to stay in double digits, led more by rising average room rates than occupancy gains.Chalet Hotels is strengthening its portfolio through the Athiva brand, while maintaining balance-sheet comfort with stable debt levels and adequate headroom to fund future expansions and acquisitions.In October-December quarter , Chalet Hotels reported revenues of ₹581, profit after tax of ₹124 crore and margins of 45.6%.These are edited excerpts of the interview.Q: What does your target stand at in terms of revenue, and what is the expectation now that we should have for FY27?A: Unfortunately, it's hard for me to give you forward numbers, but it has been an excellent growth for us. If I look at quarter three numbers at a consolidated level, we grew revenue by about 27%, with EBITDA growing by 29% but ex-residential, which is a one-off we normally see our business ex-residential, and that's also grown 23% on revenue and 24% on EBITDA, quarter-on-quarter.The other good thing is, on a nine-month consolidated basis, we have grown 24% on revenue to about ₹15,103 odd crores, and about ₹677, crores at EBITDA level, for 28% year-on-year growth. So excellent growth overall.Quarter four is also looking decent. January has been tough overall for us, but February is coming in strong, and March is coming in steady. So whilst we don't expect as strong quarter, but we do expect a quarter four also that comes in strong, and then that will bring the overall result for this year to be very good. The macros of the economy stay strong. It's broadly in favour of the industry. The demand supply arbitrage also stays, so we expect the not just the next year, next two to three years to be quite strong as well.Q: So two to three years, fair to assume that there would be about six to 8% increase in occupancy and a near double-digit sort of ADR growth. Would that be a fair estimate?A: It's interesting you say that because that if you see pan India numbers for the calendar year, and not talking financial year, because most operators report calendar year numbers, we have come in at about 67% occupancy so far pan India at about ₹8,800 average daily rate , and that brings the revenue per available room  to say ₹5,500 and that growth has been quite steady and very encouraging. And that's been the case for the last three to four years.There's no reason that we shouldn't expect a good RevPAR growth upwards and in double digits for the for the coming few years. How it will pan out between occupancy and ADR remains to be seen. But I suspect that the ADR will grow stronger than occupancy.Q: The Budget announcements that came by, the finance minister spoke about developing multiple tourism centers, etc. fell short on specific details, but the last two budgets, if you notice, the word tourism, or developing tourism, or the orange economy, has been spoken about a fair bit, they fell also short of announcing a blanket infrastructure status for the hotel industry. But be that, as it may have, you seen any formidable improvement from the government side when it comes to operating?A: It's very heartening to note that travel and tourism is finally getting its due. And the fact that, it has always been a great contributor to the GDP overall, as well as to the employment percentage. It is high time that it is written recognised as one of the key industries that contribute to the overall growth of the of the country. From that perspective, it's all been good. Some of the stuff that came through this time is also very heartening, because the approach of the government, clearly, is to improve the overall tourism infrastructure, and not just focus on one part of tourism, and that's one of the things that has been lacking in the country.The experience of tourists who have to be seen holistically and not just one segment of their holiday, so it's great that the government is looking at it that way. It is sad indeed, that our request of granting a blanket infrastructure status has not been met once more, but I am sure that with the prominence that tourism is gaining in the conversations of the government, we will be there soon. I still have that hope.Q: Now that you have decided upon this entire bouquet of Athiva properties, what is the outlook here? What do you expect in terms of business contribution coming in from this business, and also an updated number on your debt? It was a little over ₹2,000 crores that I last saw. Where is that number standard and the repayment plan so on, Athiva and debt, if you could give us some colour?A: ATHIVA, is a point of pride for us and what we have done with what was erstwhile the Dukes and is now called the Athiva Khandala is absolutely brilliant. Even a blade of grass is not the from the old hotel. We have invested over ₹170 crores in that property. And not just the product, even the service that has come out have seen absolutely fantastic reviews. So, that particular hotel is well on its way to sort of dominate the market in that particular micro market, and we are very comfortable that we will continue to do so.Our Athiva plans, as you are aware, and we have made that announcement, at this point, is to put a name across our own properties. So, we have announced 900 keys under this, including the Athiva Khandala. And it's not different from the announced pipeline. It's from within the pipeline that we will be brand agnostically assessing which hotel will fit the Athiva brand and therefore, even though it's our property, we will give it a full run against all the other brands that are available. So, as a company, we have not moved away from third party operations, Athiva is one of the offerings, and yes, we will favour it, but we will continue to assess it in a dispassionate manner.Finally, just to finish up on debt, our debt remains at about ₹2,000 odd crores that has not moved dramatically from the last time we spoke, and we are very comfortable, sort of placed, both from an internal accrual perspective and headroom to take more debt to sort of fund all our future expansions and acquisitions as they come.Live stock market updates—follow our blog

headline: Panama Petrochem Q3 profit slips 6% YoY
condensed_text: Panama Petrochem reported a muted performance in the December quarter, with profitability coming under pressure.The company’s net profit declined 5.6% year-on-year to ₹46 crore in Q3, compared with ₹49 crore in the same quarter last year. The fall in bottom line was driven by margin contraction amid a higher cost base.Revenue from operations rose 6.5% YoY to ₹775 crore, up from ₹728 crore a year ago, supported by stable demand across product segments and continued execution momentum during the quarter.EBITDA declined 3.8% YoY to ₹60.6 crore, compared with ₹61 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Inventory movement remained favourable, with a reduction of ₹15.9 crore during the quarter.Employee benefit expenses were ₹9.1 crore, finance costs stood at ₹2.4 crore, and depreciation and amortisation expense was ₹3.4 crore. Other expenses for the quarter were ₹49.7 crore.Overall, the quarter reflected stable topline growth but pressure on margins, as higher costs offset revenue gains, keeping profitability under check despite healthy operational activity.Panama Petrochem Ltd  is an Indian specialty‑petrochemical manufacturer that makes and sells chemicals derived from crude‑oil/ base‑oil feedstock to industrial customers. The company runs plants in India and the UAE and exports to the Middle East, Africa, and other regions.For the nine months ended December, Panama Petrochem’s revenue from operations grew 6.9% YoY to ₹2,241.5 crore, compared with ₹2,097.7 crore a year ago.
full_content: Panama Petrochem reported a muted performance in the December quarter, with profitability coming under pressure.The company’s net profit declined 5.6% year-on-year to ₹46 crore in Q3, compared with ₹49 crore in the same quarter last year. The fall in bottom line was driven by margin contraction amid a higher cost base.Revenue from operations rose 6.5% YoY to ₹775 crore, up from ₹728 crore a year ago, supported by stable demand across product segments and continued execution momentum during the quarter.EBITDA declined 3.8% YoY to ₹60.6 crore, compared with ₹61 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. As a result, EBITDA margin narrowed to 7.8% from 8.7% YoY, reflecting elevated operating expenses and limited operating leverage.On the cost front, total expenses for the quarter stood at ₹720.2 crore, broadly in line with last year. Cost of materials consumed was ₹574.7 crore, while purchases of stock-in-trade came in at ₹96.9 crore. Inventory movement remained favourable, with a reduction of ₹15.9 crore during the quarter.Employee benefit expenses were ₹9.1 crore, finance costs stood at ₹2.4 crore, and depreciation and amortisation expense was ₹3.4 crore. Other expenses for the quarter were ₹49.7 crore.Overall, the quarter reflected stable topline growth but pressure on margins, as higher costs offset revenue gains, keeping profitability under check despite healthy operational activity.Panama Petrochem Ltd  is an Indian specialty‑petrochemical manufacturer that makes and sells chemicals derived from crude‑oil/ base‑oil feedstock to industrial customers. The company runs plants in India and the UAE and exports to the Middle East, Africa, and other regions.For the nine months ended December, Panama Petrochem’s revenue from operations grew 6.9% YoY to ₹2,241.5 crore, compared with ₹2,097.7 crore a year ago. Net profit remained largely flat at ₹141.4 crore, versus ₹142.8 crore YoY.Shares of were trading 3.8% below at ₹294.6 on the NSE at 13:45 IST.

headline: UltraTech Cement, Dalmia Bharat & JK Cements: Axis Direct shares top conviction stock picks
condensed_text: In its sector note, the domestic brokerage said, "We remain positive as long-term demand drivers are intact and expect cement demand to grow at a CAGR of 7%-8% over FY24-27E. For UltraTech Cement, Axis Direct said, "With expanded capacity and scale, the company is positioned to strengthen its market leadership, targeting a market share increase from 25 per cent to 28 per cent. The brokerage mentioned that the company has commenced commercial production at its 3.6 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) clinker unit in Umrangso, Assam, calling it a key milestone. "In parallel, Dalmia is actively pursuing cost-saving initiatives, targeting a reduction of Rs 150–200/tonne over the next two years through enhanced operational efficiency and process optimisation," Axis's note added. On JK Cement, Axis said, "The company delivered a positive operating performance during the quarter, supported by volume growth and lower cost, leading to a 4% QoQ improvement in EBITDA per tonne to Rs 929."
full_content:
Axis Direct has reiterated a positive outlook on India's cement sector, citing strong long-term demand drivers and consolidation benefits. The brokerage identified UltraTech Cement Ltd , Dalmia Bharat Ltd and JK Cement Ltd as its top conviction stock picks from the select space, assigning each a 'Buy' rating.
In its sector note, the domestic brokerage said, "We remain positive as long-term demand drivers are intact and expect cement demand to grow at a CAGR of 7%-8% over FY24-27E. Sector consolidation is expected to benefit large players through economies of scale, supply chain efficiency, and better pricing in the long term. Cement prices, regional demand and supply dynamics, and trends in fuel costs will be key monitorables."
Axis highlighted that these three cement manufacturers are well-positioned to benefit from capacity expansion, operating leverage and cost-efficiency measures.
For UltraTech Cement, Axis Direct said, "With expanded capacity and scale, the company is positioned to strengthen its market leadership, targeting a market share increase from 25 per cent to 28 per cent. We project volume growth at a 14 per cent CAGR over FY25–27E."
The brokerage noted, "The company projects a total cost reduction of Rs 200–300 per tonne over the next 2–3 years. We project that its EBITDA margins will increase to 21 per cent in FY27E, driven by higher volume, better realisations, and cost optimisation initiatives."
It has assigned a target price of Rs 14,000 for UltraTech.
Commenting on Dalmia Bharat, Axis pointed to progress in the company's capacity expansion programme. The brokerage mentioned that the company has commenced commercial production at its 3.6 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) clinker unit in Umrangso, Assam, calling it a key milestone.
"These expansion initiatives are expected to drive future volume growth, supported by its current capacity utilisation of 60 per cent, which provides significant headroom for operating leverage. The company is projected to deliver a 7 per cent volume CAGR over FY25–27E," Axis said.
"Quarterly performance was aided by a 9 per cent YoY increase in volume, reaching 7.3 mtpa. With cement prices expected to improve in Q4, driven by better demand, margins are expected to stay elevated moving forward," it also stated.
"In parallel, Dalmia is actively pursuing cost-saving initiatives, targeting a reduction of Rs 150–200/tonne over the next two years through enhanced operational efficiency and process optimisation," Axis's note added.
The brokerage has set an upside target price of Rs 2,520 for Dalmia Bharat.
On JK Cement, Axis said, "The company delivered a positive operating performance during the quarter, supported by volume growth and lower cost, leading to a 4% QoQ improvement in EBITDA per tonne to Rs 929."
It added, "This positive momentum is expected to sustain through FY26, backed by robust cement demand and better realisations."
Axis further said, "The company anticipates savings of Rs 150-200 per tonne in the next 2 years. We expect it to report an EBITDA margin in the range of 19-20 per cent, driven by higher volumes, stable realisations, and lower costs."
For JK Cement, Axis Direct has assigned an upside target price of Rs 2,520.

headline: Aurobindo Pharma, KPR Mill stocks among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
condensed_text:
Among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 were stocks of Aurobindo Pharma, KPR Mill, PB Fintech, Hindustan Zinc and Bharti Hexacom. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending December 2025 stood at Rs 8,645.90 Crore, compared to Rs 7,978.52 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024. The following table summarizes the key yearly financial data:
Aurobindo Pharma Corporate Actions:
Bonus:Aurobindo Pharma has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus on July 20, 2015.Splits:The stock has been split, including a split from a face value of Rs 5 to Rs 1 on February 10, 2011.Dividends:In 2025, an interim dividend of Rs 4.00 per share was announced on August 4, 2025. KPR Mill Corporate Actions:
Splits:KPR Mill has split its stock, including a split from a face value of Rs 5 to Rs 1 on September 24, 2021.Dividends:In 2025, KPR Mill announced a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share on May 9, 2025, and an interim dividend of Rs 2.50 per share on February 3, 2025. Hind Zinc Corporate Actions:
Bonus:Hind Zinc had a bonus issue on March 7, 2011, with a ratio of 1:1.Splits:The stock was split from a face value of Rs 10 to Rs 2 on March 7, 2011.Dividends:Hind Zinc announced an interim dividend of Rs 10.00 per share on June 6, 2025.
full_content:
Indian markets saw some stocks facing significant declines on Tuesday. Among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 were stocks of Aurobindo Pharma, KPR Mill, PB Fintech, Hindustan Zinc and Bharti Hexacom.
Aurobindo Pharma:The stock price of Aurobindo Pharm experienced a significant decline, falling 5.75% to Rs 1,134.50. Recent corporate announcements include a board meeting outcome and completion of a US FDA inspection at Unit III of Eugia Pharma Specialities Ltd, a wholly-owned subsidiary.
KPR Mill:KPR Mill shares also saw a decrease, dropping by 2.9% to Rs 950.50.
PB Fintech:PB Fintech's stock price decreased by 2.5%, reaching Rs 1,493.80.
Hind Zinc:Hind Zinc experienced a decrease of 2.26%, with its stock price falling to Rs 614.90.
Bharti Hexacom:Bharti Hexacom shares also saw a decrease, falling by 2.01% to Rs 1,700.00.
Aurobindo Pharma's financial performance shows a fluctuating revenue trend over the past few quarters. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending December 2025 stood at Rs 8,645.90 Crore, compared to Rs 7,978.52 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024. Net profit for the same period increased from Rs 843.98 Crore to Rs 909.43 Crore. The company’s EPS also increased from Rs 14.56 to Rs 15.67.

full_content:
Indian markets saw some stocks facing significant declines on Tuesday. Among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 were stocks of Aurobindo Pharma, KPR Mill, PB Fintech, Hindustan Zinc and Bharti Hexacom.
Aurobindo Pharma:The stock price of Aurobindo Pharm experienced a significant decline, falling 5.75% to Rs 1,134.50. Recent corporate announcements include a board meeting outcome and completion of a US FDA inspection at Unit III of Eugia Pharma Specialities Ltd, a wholly-owned subsidiary.
KPR Mill:KPR Mill shares also saw a decrease, dropping by 2.9% to Rs 950.50.
PB Fintech:PB Fintech's stock price decreased by 2.5%, reaching Rs 1,493.80.
Hind Zinc:Hind Zinc experienced a decrease of 2.26%, with its stock price falling to Rs 614.90.
Bharti Hexacom:Bharti Hexacom shares also saw a decrease, falling by 2.01% to Rs 1,700.00.
Aurobindo Pharma's financial performance shows a fluctuating revenue trend over the past few quarters. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending December 2025 stood at Rs 8,645.90 Crore, compared to Rs 7,978.52 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024. Net profit for the same period increased from Rs 843.98 Crore to Rs 909.43 Crore. The company’s EPS also increased from Rs 14.56 to Rs 15.67.

full_content:
In Tuesday's session, several stocks showed significant gains, positioning them as top performers on the Nifty 50 index.
Eternalled the gains with a 5.61% increase, reaching Rs 305.05. Tata Steel followed, rising by 2.72% to Rs 207.50. Bajaj Auto also saw a notable increase of 2.21%, trading at Rs 9,801.50. TCS recorded a gain of 1.5%, trading at Rs 2,992.40, and M&M increased by 1.48% to Rs 3,663.00.
Here's a detailed look into the financial performance and corporate actions of these companies:
Eternal Limited has seen varied financial results over the past few years. Here’s an overview of their financial performance:
Key Financial Data (Consolidated):
The company's revenue has shown substantial growth from Rs 5,405.00 Crore in December 2024 to Rs 16,315.00 Crore in December 2025. Similarly, net profit has increased from Rs 59.00 Crore to Rs 102.00 Crore over the same period. The EPS has also risen from 0.07 to 0.11.
Annual Financial Performance (Consolidated):
Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 1,993.79 CroreRs 4,192.40 CroreRs 7,079.40 CroreRs 12,114.00 CroreRs 20,243.00 CroreNet Profit-Rs 816.43 Crore-Rs 1,222.80 Crore-Rs 970.70 CroreRs 351.00 CroreRs 527.00 CroreEPS-1.51-1.67-1.200.410.60BVPS246,389.5821.5923.2623.5133.43ROE-10.63-7.32-4.991.711.73Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00
The annual revenue has increased significantly from Rs 1,993.79 Crore in 2021 to Rs 20,243.00 Crore in 2025. The company turned profitable in 2024 with a net profit of Rs 351.00 Crore, which further increased to Rs 527.00 Crore in 2025.
Tata Steel has also demonstrated strong financial metrics.
Key Financial Data (Consolidated):
The quarterly revenue for Tata Steel has fluctuated, with a general increasing trend. Net profit has seen a significant rise from Rs 248.51 Crore in December 2024 to Rs 2,626.41 Crore in December 2025. The EPS has correspondingly increased from 0.26 to 2.16.
Annual Financial Performance (Consolidated):

The annual revenue for Tata Steel has generally decreased from Rs 243,959.17 Crore in 2022 to Rs 218,542.51 Crore in 2025. The net profit saw a significant decrease in 2024 but recovered to Rs 2,982.97 Crore in 2025.
Bajaj Auto has also shown positive financial results.
Key Financial Data (Consolidated):
The quarterly revenue for Bajaj Auto has grown from Rs 13,168.88 Crore in December 2024 to Rs 16,204.45 Crore in December 2025. Net profit has also increased from Rs 2,195.65 Crore to Rs 2,749.82 Crore over the same period. The EPS has risen from 78.70 to 98.50.
Annual Financial Performance (Consolidated):
The annual revenue has steadily increased from Rs 27,741.08 Crore in 2021 to Rs 50,994.55 Crore in 2025. The net profit has also risen from Rs 4,550.70 Crore to Rs 8,240.21 Crore over the same period.
TCSalso showcased robust financials.
Key Financial Data (Consolidated):
The quarterly revenue for TCS has shown a consistent increase, rising from Rs 63,973.00 Crore in December 2024 to Rs 67,087.00 Crore in December 2025. However, net profit has slightly decreased from Rs 12,444.00 Crore to Rs 10,720.00 Crore over the same period.
Annual Financial Performance (Consolidated):
The annual revenue for TCS has shown consistent growth from Rs 164,177.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,324.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also increased steadily from Rs 32,562.00 Crore to Rs 48,797.00 Crore over the same period.
M&M has demonstrated notable financial performance.
Key Financial Data (Consolidated):
The quarterly revenue for M&M has increased from Rs 37,923.74 Crore in September 2024 to Rs 46,105.67 Crore in September 2025. Net profit has also risen from Rs 2,894.71 Crore to Rs 3,494.50 Crore. The EPS has increased from 28.43 to 32.90.
Annual Financial Performance (Consolidated):
The annual revenue for M&M has increased from Rs 74,277.78 Crore in 2021 to Rs 158,749.75 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also risen significantly from Rs 2,425.26 Crore to Rs 12,535.75 Crore over the same period.

headline: Edelweiss rises 9% as Carlyle to invest Rs 2,100 crore for 45% stake in firm's unit, Q3 net profit more than doubles
condensed_text:
Shares of Edelweiss Financial Services rose 9% on February 10 as the firm's net profit more than doubled in December quarter and the firm announced that US- based Asset manager Carlyle will acquire a 45% stake in the company's unit Nido Home Finance for Rs 2,100 crore. With a robust presence across the country, Nido operates a large network of branches, serving over 800 talukas (sub-districts) in India, and currently manages an AUM of Rs 4,804 crore (approximately $530 million)," said Edelweiss in a stock exchange filing. "For Carlyle, the investment reflects its continued commitment to supporting India’s high growth housing finance sector and builds on its more than two decades of deep expertise, operating capabilities and strong track record investing in India’s financial services sector, including in housing finance businesses such as PNB Housing Finance Limited (PNBHF) and Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC)," added Edelweiss. I have deep respect for the financial services franchise that Carlyle has built over many years in India and am very excited that they will be partners to help Nido in its next stage of scale-up.”
Sunil Kaul, Partner and Asia Financial Services Sector Lead, Carlyle, said: “We are thrilled to partner with Edelweiss to support the next phase of Nido’s growth journey. Additionally, we look forward to leveraging our operational experience to support Nido in strengthening its governance and risk management frameworks for longterm sustainable growth and success.”
Edelweiss also said its alternative asset management witnessed a 33% increase fee-paying assets under management (FPAUM) at Rs 41,920 crore in the December quarter.
full_content:
Shares of Edelweiss Financial Services rose 9% on February 10 as the firm's net profit more than doubled in December quarter and the firm announced that US- based Asset manager Carlyle will acquire a 45% stake in the company's unit Nido Home Finance for Rs 2,100 crore.
The company's Q3 consolidated net profit more than doubled to Rs 264 crore year-on-year; interest income, however, fell 3.4% YoY.
At 2:20 pm on February 10,Edelweiss Financial shareswere trading 8% higher at Rs 120.4 apiece. So far in 2026, the firm's stock rose 10%.
"Established in 2010, Nido is one of India’s leading housing finance companies, providing homeloansolutions to customers across the affordable housing and mass-market segments. With a robust presence across the country, Nido operates a large network of branches, serving over 800 talukas (sub-districts) in India, and currently manages an AUM of Rs 4,804 crore (approximately $530 million)," said Edelweiss in a stock exchange filing.
"The transaction seeks to create a win-win opportunity for all stakeholders by bringing additional capital and operational expertise to better serve the affordable housing segment, predominantly in the rural and semi-urban markets in India, a key priority for the Indian government. Housing finance is an important pillar of India’s growth, underpinned by structural demand, policy support, and a deepening formal credit ecosystem. For Edelweiss, the partnership seeks to advance its objective of creating and unlocking value in its businesses, while reinforcing Nido’s growth momentum through the infusion of fresh growth capital.
"For Carlyle, the investment reflects its continued commitment to supporting India’s high growth housing finance sector and builds on its more than two decades of deep expertise, operating capabilities and strong track record investing in India’s financial services sector, including in housing finance businesses such as PNB Housing Finance Limited (PNBHF) and Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC)," added Edelweiss.
Aditya Puri, Senior Advisor to Carlyle in Asia, and former CEO and Managing Director of HDFC Bank, will also participate as an investor, said the NBFC.
Rashesh Shah, Chairman & MD, Edelweiss, said: “The investment by Carlyle in Nido is a key milestone and brings in a high-quality, long-term partner to accelerate Nido’s next phase of growth. At a time when India’s housing finance sector is witnessing strong structural demand, supported by rising affordability and deeper access to formal credit, Nido is well-placed to participate meaningfully in this opportunity. I have deep respect for the financial services franchise that Carlyle has built over many years in India and am very excited that they will be partners to help Nido in its next stage of scale-up.”
Sunil Kaul, Partner and Asia Financial Services Sector Lead, Carlyle, said: “We are thrilled to partner with Edelweiss to support the next phase of Nido’s growth journey. Housing remains a critical national priority for India, and we have strong conviction in the growth potential of the housing finance industry. We are excited to build on our extensive experience in financial services and housing finance to help Nido scale its operations and serve the expanding needs of affordable housing segments in the rural and semi-urban markets. Additionally, we look forward to leveraging our operational experience to support Nido in strengthening its governance and risk management frameworks for longterm sustainable growth and success.”
Edelweiss also said its alternative asset management witnessed a 33% increase fee-paying assets under management (FPAUM) at Rs 41,920 crore in the December quarter.
During the quarter, its mutual fund business equity AUM surged 33% as well to Rs 83,000 crore and its SIP book crossed the Rs 500 crore-mark after increasing 55% from the previous year.
